Reviews.Title: “Great, for the time we spent there!”
Reviews.Author: Abby L
Reviews.Content: In all honesty, we barely spent any time in this room. With that being said, the size of the room did not matter (while on the small side). The room was clean, and all the things you need to simply sleep in a room were provided. After our room was serviced one day, they had taken away our bath towels and replaced all the towels with hand towels. When we called to get bath towels, were were told that the laundry delivery service did not show up that day. We had to dry off using hand towels that day, but it worked, so that is a very little complaint. The next day we had normal size bath towels again. After coming from a somewhat 'luxury' hotel in London, we were bummed to see the room did not have an alarm clock or refrigerator, but it had a safe, it was warm, the bed was comfortable, it was clean, and we had hot water. Great place to stay if you are taking trains in or out of the city as it is close to Gare de l'Est and Gare de Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sjhHove
Reviews.Content: We booked this excellent three star hotel hotel as part of a Eurostar package and I'd highly recommend it. It's10 minutes walk from Eurostar at the Gare du Nord and a stone's throw from the smartened up Gare de l'Est and the metro. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and, if you need it, speak excellent English. Breakfast is 10 euros and looked good but there are plenty of cafes and brasseries nearby both by the station and along the Canal St Martin. Our room, on the top floor, was small but well equipped with a very comfy bed and a lovely view over the park and the canal. The bathroom was clean, with good products, soft towels, a powerful shower and plenty of hot water. My very minor niggle was the lack of an extractor fan in the bathroom which got very steamy. but the hotel has recently been taken over by the excellent Tim hotel chain and I'm sure things like this will be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Gare de l'Est (formerly Villa Saint Martin)”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda M
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was an absolute gem! It was extremely clean, with a remodeled bathroom and a big screen tv. The breakfast was generous, and the staff were not only friendly, but genuinely kind! You can't fake that folks! The train station (subway and bus as well) is a block away, making it a very nice location. Great deal for the price! Enjoy! Elenora R. and Rhonda M. Mesa, AZ.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaMackay
Reviews.Content: Was really nervous in bo oking this motel as only viewed it on the Internet. Shouldn't have worried. Lovely clean & quiet motel in a fantastic location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were tastefully decorated and although small fully equipped. The only possible problem I could find was if you are a large person it would be difficult to fit In the shower as it is very tiny. The breakfast was quite adequate & enjoyable. I would definitely stay here again on our return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Hayley G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money, although the rooms were a bit small (and the bed). The staff were very helpful and friendly and the location was very good, 2 minute walk to the nearest metro station, also the Paris open bus tour has a stop right next the hotel too. There are plenty of shops, bars and cafes within easy walking distance of the hotel. The breakfast was ok, as it was a bit chaotic and they ran out of english breakfast tea on our last morning!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: Gilzy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were on the small side, but overall I had a very pleasant stay. The hotel was very close to the train station and the bus was easily located!!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - friendly welcome and brilliantly located”
Reviews.Author: Lhommedesmarais
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here and was very pleased with my stay. I booked with Eurostar and paid just under £350 (around 420€/US$550) room only, including return Eurostar from London which I thought was very reasonable. Staff on reception (24h/24) were very helpful and friendly, and although I managed to get by in French it appeared that most also spoke reasonable English. My room (a double, 3rd floor, accessed by a small lift) was perhaps a little small for a couple, but for me as a solo traveller, it was fine, and it was really just somewhere to sleep; the lack of view didn't bother me for the same reason. Cleanliness was perfectly adequate, although there were a few traces of mildew in the shower in the otherwise spotless bathroom. Daily visits by the friendly maid kept the room tidy throughout my stay. The room also featured free wifi, cable TV, hairdryer, safe and plenty of wardrobe space. Breakfast, served from 6h30 to 10h00, was a generous self-service buffet of coffee/tea/fruit/cold meats/cheese/cereal/juice/petit pain and a selection of pastries (croissant/pain au chocolat etc.). Not haute cuisine, but very reasonably priced at 10€. But if that doesn't appeal, there are plenty of bars/cafes nearby. The hotel is superbly located, being 10 minutes' walk from Gare du Nord (ideal for those arriving by Eurostar) and 2 minutes from Gare de l'Est, so even though it's a little way out of the city centre (Xe arrondissement), there are excellent transport links to all the main sights by bus/metro/RER virtually on the doorstep. And even though this is a busy area of Paris, the hotel is down a little side street - Rue des Récollets - so I didn't notice any noise. Opposite is a local park (Jardin Villemin), while at the far end of Rue des Récollets is the Canal Saint-Martin (and the bridge on which Amelie stood in the film!) so there are peaceful spots nearby to relax. I would give Villa Saint-Martin 4.5/5, only deducting half a mark for the mildew in the shower and the slightly small size of the room - but these didn't detract from my stay at all and I only mention these in order to be objective. I would recommend to others and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bargain”
Reviews.Author: Walter C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 6 night stay at this hotel through a package deal with Gate 1 Travel, including air to and from Chicago. The entire cost per person was only $940! The hotel was quite comfortable, with a very helpful staff, generous and tasty breakfast, and good in room internet and TV. The location (right next to the Gare de L'Est) was perfect, so in combination with a Paris Museum Pass and Paris Visite transit pass, we got a wonderful vacation at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for paris”
Reviews.Author: brendan75
Reviews.Content: Room was ok for paris,breakfast was typical european,5 min walk from metro,free wifi.reception staff very good

Reviews.Title: “Our Latest Stay @ Villa St. Martin”
Reviews.Author: foodsniffer
Reviews.Content: This was our third year in a row to stay at this hotel. The pros: Great location in the 10th district between the canal and Gare de l'est and within waling distance of Gare de Nord. Great front desk staff- very helpful and all speak English. Large rooms by European standards with our request for the room we had the year before accommodated. Acceptable breakfast but questionable as to if it is worth the price. Great restaurants nearby, (Papilles, Chez Marie Louise, and Les Enfants Perdus, (down the street)). The Cons: Establishment, which was family owned, has been sold to a chain, (TimHotel), and personal attention seems to be lacking- i.e. we had several problems in our room which were not addressed in a timely manner, but were eventually resolved. If you have a room facing the street, (whcih we requested), there is a certain amount of street noise. You can hear people in adjoining rooms if they are conversing loudly. We do enjoy the Villa St. Martin, are dissapointed it has been sold to a chain, but will return.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable quality hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bjmchale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa St. Martin for 1 week in Paris. Paris was freezing but fantastic. The hotel was fantastic. Near the Gare de L'est train (get the all day pass if you plan on touring Paris), and near to several eating places. It is close enough to walk but you will have to go a short way to get to the main attractions like Eiffel, Louvre. The best part of the Hotel was the breakfast. Very good selection (cheese, meet, croissant, cereal, yogurt, etc) and the automatic expresso machine was delectable. The reception staff were friendly and personable. The rooms were small but comfortable and clean. One night we didn't know how to turn the heat on and we froze, but figured it out the nights thereafter. Also, the en suite safe was locked so we couldn't access it. It's a top quality 3 star and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xainis
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel based on the reviews I found here, that created a lot of expectations. Unfortunately they have not been fulfilled. The hotel location is one of its greatest advantages. Almost next to Gard De' lest and very near to Gard Du Nord, can be used as a base for visiting Paris Center and many closeby cities (by train). The area is full of small restaurants, with decent food. Many options available, from local French bistrots, to tex-mex and even Japanese food. My comments/observations for the hotel itself: + Reception girls were very polite and friendly + Free high speed wi-fi available and satelite tv (Free as well) + Location - Very expensive for the quality and services offered (paid around 160 euros per night) - One of the worst breakfasts buffets I ever had.. Very limited options and mainly ready made. Even the juice was not fresh and the cofee from an automatic machine - Small rooms and quite noisy because of the thin walls.. - The shower floor was dirty and that was a suprise since the rest of the room was very clean In general I would not visit it again and I would not suggest it, unless you find a very good offer

Reviews.Title: “An ok base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: twoplustwoLancashire
Reviews.Content: As per an earlier review - this is now TImotel (from 1st Jan). The hotel was ok - but wouldn't want to spend much more than a couple of days there. The rooms are very small and dark, although very clean. The beds are quite small, but the bedding immaculate. Shower leaked badly, so floor was flooded every time we took a shower. Breakfast was really a lottery. If you got there early before the rush, it was very nice with fresh bread, hams and cheeses and on occasions boiled eggs. There was also fresh fruit, yoghurt and pastries. However, the dining room is VERY small given the number of bedrooms, so if you don't get there early enough there are neither seats, food or crockery left! It would appear they are severely understaffed in the breakfast room. No one clearing tables or replenishing the food area. The one big positive is that the ladies on reception were always very pleasant and very helpful. The area is lovely - although it looks a little run down at first, its really a very safe area. Step out of the hotel and turn right, and there are several bars and restaurants on each side of the street. A particular mention to L'Atmosphere at the bottom of the street on the left hand side. Good little bar for a drink. Chez Marie Louise is a restaurant about 10 mins walk away and the food and service here are top class - however, would recommend booking as it was full on a Thursday night and people were being turned away. Les Enfants Perdu is another restaurant on Rue Recollets (turn right outside the hotel and walk a couple of hundred yards and the restaurant is on the left) which served excellent food but again would be advantageous to book. You can walk from Gard Du Nord (10 - 15 min walk with luggage) or from Gard D'Est (3 minute walk with luggage)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: BenW87
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from Paris, and a stay at Villa Saint Martin... Absolutely brilliant hotel; great distance from gare du nord and gare de l'est (10 mins maximum!) clean throughout, beautiful rooms and generally modern and pleasant whilst still in keeping with typical Parisian style. Good continental selection for breakfast in the mornings, certainly worth getting out of bed for! The staff were made this for us; friendly and pleasant (even first thing in the morning whilst finishing a night shift!) would definitely be happy to go back to villa saint Martin over and over, based on the attitude and manner of the staff. Good work; to all at villa saunt martin - keep it up - highly recommended! :-)

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sandra1271
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Villa Saint Martin (now a Timhotel, I believe). It is a small hotel close to Gare de l'Est and only a few minutes walk from Gare du Nord. The rooms are well-equiped, clean and quiet. The main advantage is the friendliness of the reception staff - they always greet you with a smile and go out of their way to help. For such good value, the service is beyond what one would expect. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super small hotel - very convenient for international train travel out of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JMHGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: A great find - only a few minutes walk from Gare du Nord / Gare Est so great for connection further into continental Europe and UK. Very welcoming and helpful. Rooms small but very clean and comfortable. Breakfast simple but good. Excellent restaurant around 100m down the road Les Enfants Perdus was recommended by the hotel and proved to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable, convenient location and great value”
Reviews.Author: LondonOiseau
Reviews.Content: Close to the Gare de l'Est and an easy few minutes walk from Gare du Nord, even with a wheely case. Reception were very friendly and English speaking. The rooms are clean and comfortable, modest in size but larger than many places in Paris and very good value. There are some nice bistros and bars close to the hotel, particularly those on the Canal Saint-Martin, which is a great canal-side walk down to the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, Close to Gare DE L'EST, Lovely staff and smallish but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: nickylloyd1968
Reviews.Content: Firstly a little about getting to the hotel itself. If you arrive on the Eurostar and don't want to walk (About 15 mins to hotel) or take a taxi, go via metro. Line No: 4 (Direction Porte d'orleans) from Gare Du Nord to Gare De L'est (One stop) When you exit Gare de l'est turn left and walk towards the end of the road (don't go down Boulevard Strasbourg) go down Rue de Faubourg St Martin. If you cross the traffic lights you will see Rue des Recollets on the left and the hotel is on the right hand side. When we arrived at the hotel (about 11.am) our room wasn't ready but we were able to check in and leave our luggage. The hotel itself overall was brilliant. (Note for ladies there are hairdryers in the bathrooms) The staff - Mariana, Helena and Charlotte were superb and spoke good English. Nothing was too much trouble and when we wanted to go to Parc de Prince stadium they rang ahead to get details for us! Breakfast is served in the bar area until 10am - buffet style and was good. The rooms are well insulated compared to others I've stayed in and though small were perfectly functional. There are varying reviews on which floor to stay but we stayed on the 4th floor (room 445 - twin room) which was at the front of the hotel. There was a lift too.The road noise is minimal and as we were higher up it was ok. Bathroom was good and modern, though if you didn't want to flood the bathroom floor make sure you put the shower curtain inside the shower tray! There was hand cream and hair/shower gel in the bathroom too. Overall a great stay, the staff superb and I would recommend this hotel to anyone while staying in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good clean cosy rooms, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: oliviadorothy
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this great, no frill hotels and found the staff and service nothing less than exemplary. From the outset, when I arrived before check in time, the staff went out of their way to accommodate me. I asked for a quiet room and got a lovely one at the back of the hotel immediately. When I was whammied by a migraine headache on the second day I rang down to reception and was brought a couple of painkillers along with - without asking! - some coffee and orange juice by the very kind Charlotte (who speaks perfect English!). I travel to Paris a lot in my line of work as a journalist and rarely write reviews of hotels - so this one really comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: gcee29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights 7th Jan. Super location..1min from Gare d'lest station and metro. We got off at CDG airport and just jumped straight on the Bus dropped off an hour later right at hotel for 5 euros. Cant argue with that. Train takes u to Gare Nord then you will have to get the metro. Hotel rooms are very small yes, but we were hardly in ours...only to sleep late at night after walking Paris which is beautiful at night. Metro passes are a MUST.(20 euros each for a paris visite pass for 3 days at any station also comes with discount booklet for sites etc) City is very big...first day we walked alot, following day we were doing the metro and seen MUCH more stuff. It just felt great at anytime to hop on and off anywhere u wanted like Eiffel Tower at night then off to Sacre Couer to watch over the City. Staff at hotel are extremely helpful, speak perfect english although i try my best to speak in french. Breakfast is continental but plenty of it. Hams, Cheeses, Boiled Eggs, Croissants, Breads, Jams and coffee. Top tip..coffee machine push for cafe au lait then push for expresso so u get a shot in it as quite weak on its own. We personally never bothered getting the Paris Pass or museum passes as for a few days they are not worth it as you will never ever have the time to visit everywhere. We done things included in these passes that we wanted like the Lourve, Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame and crypt, Catacombs, Parisien river cruise and Metro passes for cheaper than the tourist passes. It all depends on how much time you have and what you want to visit. Its worth planning and researching beforehand!! Eating out can be expensive..best to go for a Plat de Jour, which is a set menu, we found a lovely French Traditional place and got salmon and herring for starters, 10oz Rump, then cheeses plus bottle of red for 53 euros. Exremely good price..we just stumbled on it, very small cozy and quaint and typical french. Japanese is big here...we got a good deal over in the Latin Quarter for Sushi and its excellent..less than 40 euros with drinks. If you wanna pay top dollar then dont worry, easy to find..we read a menu..5 Course with Bottlle of wine and glass of champagne for only 830 euros!!! YES...830 euros haha. So always check the menu prices outside before sitting down and embarrasing yourself by getting up to leave again at some monstrous price. There are hundreds of hotels in Paris scattered everywhere but this was the best 3star deal we found which incidentally had the best reviews. We liked it and had a nice view of the city and the top of Eiffel. Good as a base....and that is all u need in Paris...keep the extra dosh for sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: adhn
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel is within walking distance to Gare de L'Est where we took the Metro and Gare du North where we took the train to Belgium, 1 hour away. If you turn right from the hotel, there is a beautiful Thai restaurant and several other restaurants. There is a market if you cross the bridge over the St Martin Canal where you can buy drinks and food. The Canal is on the right of the hotel. It's pretty and we walked there at night when we could not sleep. There are also some cute boutiques along the canal. If you turn left from the hotel and left again on the main street, the Istanbul cafe, a Middle eastern restaurant has good eats for very reasonable price. I recommend the curry chicken and the shawerma sandwich. After meals, you get free chai tea on the house. Abdullah who waited on us was a sweetheart and can speak some English. His family owns the restaurant. There is plenty of seating upstairs. When you look inside the restaurant, it doesn't look like there is any seating left, but the entire 2nd floor has tables and is quite nice. Hotel rooms are a bit small but you are in the city. Staff can speak English really well and very helpful. Buffet breakfast is excellent with many choices. At night, we went to the lounge area and ordered beer or wine from the front desk. Cons: my room 112, the bathroom smells bad from the floor drain, may be the plumbing did not not have a shield or was not done properly? My sister who stayed in another room did not have this problem. When you take a shower, the surrounding area gets kind of wet. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We weren't disapointed”
Reviews.Author: cpal0807
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Gare L'Est - an easy 5 min walk. Our room, although small was comfortable and very cliean. The hotel is not on a main road and therefore very quiet. Our tarrif included a continental breakfast which had an ample selection of foods to choose from. The hotel's best asset is it's reception staff who were polite and friendly and helpful. We only had two full days in Paris and the staff's suggestions meant that we could make the most of this wonderful city in a short time. Catch a No.30 bus from opposite Gare L'Est and this route will take you past Moulin Rouge, near Montmarte right around to Champs Elysee and Trocadero for only a few Euro. Well done staff.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: elloie18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and in a great location, the staff was very helpful. The room was well heated and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel outside the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: travel_sweeties
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Exceeded our expectations. Everyone was helpful from the time we booked to the time we checked out. Our room was upgraded to a junior suite because it was our anniversary & my birthday. They have modern furnishings & is kept clean. Hallways are narrow & elevator is small but it wasn't a problem for us. Location is very close to train station so eventhough it was outside of the city center, everything was accessible. The Gar d'lest station is probably the nicest we've seen there. It has a shopping area inside of the station. They have good breakfast. There are restaurants around the hotel too. The one down the street serves good French cuisine though a little pricey. Thanks VSM especially to Benedicte, Agatha & the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Value, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Alan W
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and very helpful with directions. Room was very clean. Quiet area. Only few minutes walk from Gare de L'est Station. Some nice restaurant and cafes nearby. HSBC bank only less than 2 blocks away. Supermarket also nearby. Would definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: onmyway007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and had a wonderful experience! The staff was more than helpful...offering advice as to where to eat, where to find this and that as well as providing expert directions. Any time we had a question, any time we had a special request...it was taken care of. The room was small but comfortable and clean. The breakfast was excellent. What more can I say than the entire staff at Villa Saint Martin was instrumental in making this a more than memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: samandpaulRaunds
Reviews.Content: Everything you need from a hotel, very compact and bijou but rooms very comfortable. Excellent location, right near gare du l'est and metro stations. Breakfast was lovely, continental style but plenty of it and enough to set you up for the day. You don't go Paris to spend time sitting in a hotel so to get your head down, have a shower and breakfast it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Stepballchange
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night but would consider going back. Good points: Very close to Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est, in a road which is a bit run-down but seemed safe. Substantial breakfast, free internet, room was a good size (for Paris) and the bathroom was tiny but clean. Staff very helpful and friendly. Bad points: a bit noisy, whole place could do with being updated, the double bed in my room was 2 single mattresses stuck together with a double sheet on top. Corridors dark with a strange system of lighting - sense monitors which took some time to turn on. This being a Paris hotel the lift and corridors were extremely narrow, you might have some trouble if you have bulky and heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff, clean quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsliase
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed four nights in the Villa St Martin and were pleasantly surprised at the level of service. The reception staff in particular were always helpful and friendly, booking meal reservations for us, giving directions and changing our room when the first room we had proved warmer than we were comfortable with. The rooms at the front of the building can get very warm and opening the window cools the room but also let's in noise from the street below. We were moved to a quiet room at the rear of the building which was much larger, at no extra cost and the staff were full of apologies for our discomfort. Buffet breakfast was included in the room rates and was always to a good standard. This is worth around 10 euros a night. In Paris, if you are comparing hotel prices be sure to check the breakfast on offer. The hotel is an easy 10 minute walk from the Gare Du Nord, for those of us coming in through Charles De Gaulle airport and is two minutes' walk from the Gare de l'est. The Metro from Gare de l'est will take you to the centre of Paris in 10 - 15 minutes depending on your destination and is 1.25 euros if you buy a book of 10 tickets. There a few nice restaurants within walking distance and the area around the canal St. Martin seems to be quite hip at the moment with a lot of young locals in the cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: leftgeorge
Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel across Gare de L'EST metro & train station that is a convenient place to stay. Breakfast was very good providing a good variety of fresh food. Hot drinks were from a machine and that was the only thing that was average. Hotel Staff was very helpful and would

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel, staff a delight!”
Reviews.Author: magicmat
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business and pleasure trip, and this hotel was IDEAL! It was lovely to be such a short distance from the train station upon arrival. I actually walked, with 2 large cases, from Gard Nord, and it wasent too much trouble (although lots of steps, I dont think Paris is very diasabled-friendly.) The hotel staff couldnt have been more pleasant and helpful, a total credit to the hotel. They were friendly, knowledgable, spoke perfect English (i felt a bit ignorant!), and helped me book an unusual itinary, where there was no commision involved for them (I went on a Segway Tour, the best thing ever!). I was upgraded to a superior room, which was light, spacious, and in very good order. The location is out of the centre, but quite, and very close to the Metro. Go for a wander, there are some lovely shops and cafe's by the canal waiting to be discovered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Leeann327
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff went above & beyond to be helpful to us. The rooms were great - a bit bigger than my previous experiences in Paris. Very clean and very quiet. Great location - near Metro & near Les Enfants Restaurant, less than a minute walk away. Would HIGHLY recommend & I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel :))”
Reviews.Author: Crina S
Reviews.Content: Small hotel near the metro, in a typical residential neighborhood. Very close to the metro and easy to get around. Clean, small but not too small rooms even for a single room, the double superior are big for Paris. Very clean and for the first time a very good breakfast, you had multiple choices which is quite unusual for Paris. Staff was always ready to help anyway they could and they made me feel welcome. Perfect stay for Paris :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sageds
Reviews.Content: Room is a bit small but reasonably priced considering it is Paris. Quiet location, off touristy spot. Staff is very helpful and friendly, speaks good english. Only 1 power socket so prepare to ask for extension cable if you have a few gadgets. Pillows are too soft, room's lights too dim but well, you would hardly stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for reasonable price, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: reboy_11
Reviews.Content: we just got home last night from 10 days in Europe. We stayed the last 4 nights here. It was more than we expected. Staff was very helpful, friendly, accomodating, and anxious to please their guests. It is a little far from the madding crowd, but that is sometimes a good thing. We walked everywhere from this hotel...to the Eiffel Tower and back with no problems. We will definitely return the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IpswichTourist_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa St. Martin for three nights and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience. Although we were concerned that the hotel was located at quite a distance from the main tourist sights, it was very near the Metro (which is cheaper and easier to use than the London Underground), and it only took us about 40 minutes to walk back from Notre Dame anyway. The breakfast was served between 6.30 and 10.00- we just about made it to the 10 am sitting every day! Breakfast consisted of breads and cheeses alongside pasteries and cereal and fruit. A very appealing affair. The room was small but bright and clean and the toiletries in the bathroom were great! The staff were really friendly and keen to please. All in all a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “In a quiet, non-touristy corner of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JaniceHolland
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our adult son shared a Junior Suite at this hotel in September 2011. We were quite pleased with the service, friendliness, cleanliness and quiet of our upstairs, streetside room. Located in the charming Canal St. Martin area of the 10th Arrondissement of Paris, the hotel is closeby to shops, cafes, restaurants, and the lovely Canal with it's steep walking bridges. One is hard-pressed to find tourists here, with the streets filled instead with young adults and young families with small children. One can feel so like a local here. A grocery store is down the block and the Metro just 1 1/2 blocks away. The Place de la Repubblique, with its busting shopping and restaurant scene is just a 12 minute easy walk. I recommend it for all ages. It is "doing Paris easy" without the frenetic tourist scene. Go!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend in Paris for my wife's birthday and we stayed at the Villa St Martin for 2 nights. The staff we more than helpful, no question was too much trouble, directions and personal recommendations were always accurate and there was always a smiling face at the reception to greet you. Our room was cosy and met all our needs for qiuet and comfortable evenings after busy day's spent in the hustle and bustle of the city. The standards of cleanliness were high with rooms being cleaned and fresh towels added daily. Breakfast was self service , the assortment of continental fayre was enough to cover anyones palate and was fresh and tasty. It is a small hotel , but it has a lot of plus points in its favour for the weary traveller once you have navigated the somewhat run down area between the station and the Rue the hotel is located on. A fantastic find is just a few hundred yards from the hotel to the right as you exit Les Enfants Perdus Restaurant, Great Food,Great Atmosphere, Friendly Garcon and an owner who steers the ship from his office behind the well stocked bar 10/10. ( So good we ate their 2 nights.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff makes Villa St Martin”
Reviews.Author: VernonGrey
Reviews.Content: We are a couple with a six month old baby, and wanted a hotel within walking distance of Gare du Nord. We decided on this hotel and it perfectly suited our needs. The staff were wonderful, assuring us on numerous occasions if there is anything they could do re: baby food and bottles, they were happy to help.In addition to being very helpful, they were genuine and friendly. Continental breakfast was lovely, and easily kept us going until late lunch. Thanks to baby, we had breakfast around 8ish and the place was usually empty, although on my way out at 9.30am, it seemed busy. The location is good and about half an hour to forty mins walk away from centre of Paris. I like walking and easily made my way around Paris, seeing the main sites without using public transport. Rooms are smallish and fairly average. But all in all we had an above average stay, due to location, price and especially the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela T
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here from October 13-16 for my first time in Paris. So cute and quaint! The staff is very friendly and are English speaking, which is always a plus (my French is quite rusty). The hotel is about a 2 minute walk to Gare De L'est, which is where the metro was located. It was a very safe neighborhood, we had no problems at all walking around late at night. The breakfast buffet was great and I thought the coffee machine was awesome. You can get hot chocolate, cafe au lait cappucino or regular coffee from it. All in all, a very nice stay in Paris. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Forget your faceless hotel chain, a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: diarmaid f
Reviews.Content: I booked as a surprise wedding anniversary trip for my wife. We were coming on eurostar so wanted something close to the train station. It's 10 min walk from garde de nord, 2 min if you metro it to Garde de Este. It's just off the main boulavarde, over the road from a nursery and sits in an up and coming young professionals area- chic kids clothes shops, restaurants, bars, canal etc. I'd phoned ahead for flowers and champange and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and upgraded us to a large comfortable room. the first night they booked us in an excellent restaurant next door- in our opinion probably one of the best in paris, Les Enfants Perdus. an excellent breakfast. Overall a wonderful place to stay for a different 'less touristy' experience of paris with convenient access to everywhere by metro or by running shoes (as I was marathon training on our visit!) we had an excellent experience staying in Villa Saint Martin and wouldn't hesitate to return there again or recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: mattley23
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 3 day break with my wife in Paris, France and stayed at the Villa Saint Martin hotel. The hotel is located an easy 5mins walk from the Gare De Este metro station and about a 15 min walk from Gade De Nord station. We were welcomed by a friendly French hotel worker who explained about the hotel, our room and location in good detail and was very fluent in English. Our room was small but we expected this due to us being in Paris, afterall it was just a place to lay our head at the end of the day so we were happy. 1 small point I would make, me and my wife are both about 5ft9 and our feet dangled off the end of the bed so anyone 6ft or bigger may struggle with the bed size of the standard rooms. Having said that the bed was comfy and the aircon worked well as we visited during a 30degree October heatwave!! The location of the hotel is in a busy area with shops, cafes and bars but we felt very safe even when walking home at 12:30am after getting off at the wrong metro station. There is a night club by the hotel but we didnt hear a peep from other guests let alone the club during our time there and this was through a Friday and Saturday night! The hotel is just a 20 m in bus ride from the Troccadero and Eiffal Tower and extremely close to all other major tourist destinations like Sacre Coeur, Arc de triomphe and Notre Dame etc. We had breakfast (additional charge) which consisted of cerials, pastrys, meat, cheese, fruit and eggs which was perfect for us and kept us filled up all morning. Check out was swift and easy and we even delt with an English employee who was great. All the staff were a pleasure to deal with and made our visit that much better. Overall we had a very good experience staying in Villa Saint Martin and wouldnt hesitate to return there again or recommend to friends and family should they ever visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: Villa Saint martin has got to be the best 3 star hotel we have ever stayed in.Room really much bigger than we expected with a large comfortable bed.The bathroom was quite large and really modern and clean.The breakfast was better than we expected and the coffee quite good.All of the staff (and I mean all the staff) were really helpfull and went out of their way to assist with anything we asked.Nothing was too much trouble and always with a smile.Very close to Gare de l'Est.Would have no hesitation staying again and will recommend to anyone who asks.Ken and Barb Williams - Australia

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge-Yaira
Reviews.Content: I had been in Paris before and I was certain that the rooms for a three star hotel were going to be small, so that was not a surprise, yet it felt comfy and the bathroom had a modern look. The shower's "curtain" is a glass door which will not cover much and it is inevitable to get the floor wet. My wife says that for the ladies reading this, they have complimentary Yves Rocher beauty products instead of the cheap normal soap and shampoo. Hot running water was available, the bed was comfortable and an occasional siren or children's laughter in the morning was heard (There is a school in front.) The only minus was that the TV's were wired a bit strange and the volume was too low. (But, I wasn't in Paris to watch TV...) The service was excellent!! There's an employee at the front desk 24 hours, (I've been in hotels where the employee leaves during the evening and comes back in the morning!) There's complimentary continental breakfast which makes things easier to go sightseeing early. Great location by the train station!!! If you're there in the evenings during the weekend, say hi to Mariana for us... ;-P

Reviews.Title: “Decent and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Astello39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located along a quiet lane nearby the Gare de l'est station - pretty convenient although the nearest convenience store is about a 5-7 mins walk. The room is small but very clean, well kept and comfortable. Service staff are friendly and helpful. They provide laptops for use in the breakfast room with wireless internet connection at no charge - a nice touch. For a Paris hotel at this price and location, it is a value for money choice. I will stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: M_Granada
Reviews.Content: Great deal! Rooms were European-style (so take heed Americans, rooms are on the small side if you have space issues this is not for you). Very close to Gare de L'est so very handy in getting around Paris! My experience was wonderful because of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: StephTodd
Reviews.Content: We picked the Villa Saint Martin based on both Trip Advisor reviews as well as reviews on the European Destinations website (we booked a Paris/Rome trip through them). Everything was as expected--good location near the Metro, clean, good-sized rooms, very nice staff, a bar to hang out in before calling it a night, good breakfast, etc. One of the staff recommended a nearby restaurant, Les Enfants Perdu. It was one of our favorite meals of the entire trip. Great recommendation. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Gare de l'Est”
Reviews.Author: reluctantflyer007
Reviews.Content: Just a two minute walk from the Gare de l'Est and less than 10 minutes from the Gare du Nord, this hotel is ideally situated yet quiet. I slept with the window open and only the occasional sound of a siren got through to my room - otherwise very peaceful. The bed was very comfortable (not so common in France) and, although the room was very small, it was clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly (also not necessarily the norm in France) and the breakfast was good - not just the usual croissant and coffee but a proper continental breakfast with cold meats, cheeses and boiled eggs. All in all - to be recommended. (I have given only 2 points for the restaurant since I only had breakfast there and do not even know if they serve other meals).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Gare de la East”
Reviews.Author: SUBIRGHOSH
Reviews.Content: Very good location just opposite to the East station. Rooms are clean and modern. Bathroom is also very nice. The Hotel was short of adequate number of ac plug adapters (which they should not) but the front desk Ladies were very help-full and somehow manage to charge my camera. The front desk is occupied 24 hours. The staffs are all very friendly. The cold breakfast is also nice with lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean but small room, iffy location.”
Reviews.Author: Ron R
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in what seems to me to be a questionable neiborhood. I was not overly confident during any evening/night venture. It was very close to the train and metro stations however. The hotel itself had a wonderfully polite and helpful staff, and a pleasant breakfast. They even allowed me use of the hotel computer to check on a tour I had scheduled. The rooms are small by American standards and the bathroom was quite cramped. There is a section of rooms that have no elevator. Overall it was a fine choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Saman1980
Reviews.Content: We were there in late July , The hotel is absolutely the meaning of the Value For The Money, The location is fantastic , not too far from Paris attractions , there are 2 main metro stations around the hotel , one of them just about 2 minute walk! There is nothing special of course about the rooms and breakfast because it is a 3 star hotel , there is no refrigerator in the rooms, the ails are too narrow that two people can hardly pass each other, a bath can not be smaller than this but everything is very clean and tidy. the last and one of the most important positive point for the hotel is the staff specially the girls at the reception! they are very kind, smiley and helpful , thank you all . I hope I see Paris for the third time next year and of course I will stay in Villa Saint Martin.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Butchik
Reviews.Content: -The room we had was small but clean and comfortable for two people with 2 check in size luggage. In the bathroom, we had to put a towel on the floor as the shower sliding doors had a small gap that let some water out. -We had some issue with the TV/remote but the staff was able to fix it as soon as we came back from our sightseeing in the city. -The bed was comfortable though we wish that they could have 4 pillows for staying couples. The air conditioner works fine. -For ice, you have to ask the receptionist and she will get some for you in the bar. -The ladies from the front desk were nice and helpful. Always smiling and greeting us during the day. We enjoyed the breakfast selections that they offered. They had 3 choices of meat slices, pastries, orange juice, cereal, boiled eggs etc. They also have a coffee machine for 3-4 different kinds of coffee -The location is convenient as the line 4 metro is about a 2-5 minute walk. If you are taking the RER B from the airport, it took us 10-15 minutes walk from the Gare du Nord train station. We also walked to Sacre Coeur from the hotel. We felt safe walking back to the hotel at around 11 pm. -Overall, we were satisfied with our stay and would come back due to the convenient location. I do not know how big the superior rooms are so expect small quarters (we had a double room) If you want a spectacular area of Paris you might want to look at other neighborhoods but as a home base for your city travels, this hotel will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “so friendly polite clean comfortable rooms in a secure location”
Reviews.Author: LadyRaquelle
Reviews.Content: WOW..from the moment we arrived we were impressed bags taken from us and secured in a locked room. Our rooms were small and toilet door didn't fit the frame however this is the norm in paris all rooms are small,the bed was so comfortable we had extra pillows and there was no noise at night time i have to say i loved the air conditioning .The breakfast was lovely fresh fruit meats cheese coffee machine and plenty of pastry's bread rolls and even english tea. Lovely canal opp with lots of bars with happy hours 5-8 and lovely tai restuarant a few steps away. I recommend this hotel as its so close to the stations metros and this hotel is so friendly and will go that extra mile to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, clean room, good location”
Reviews.Author: StacyScottyAlan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days during our vacation in Paris, France August 2011. The hotel is very close to Gare Du L'Est train station which has Metro and ReR trains. The people who work there are incredibly nice and go out of their way to be helpful. We felt that they had a personal interest in helping us have a good time while we were in Paris. The room we stayed in was called a Jr. Suite, and was small by US standards, but accomodated my husband, myself and our 16 year old son. It was clean when we arrived and the housekeeper kept the bathroom clean and our beds made. The beds were comfortable. We were very glad we stayed with them.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Rachel H
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with this hotel, for multiple reasons: lovely staff who were helpful at all hours, storage of our luggage before checkin and after checkout to accomodate us at no cost, very comfortable beds, quiet nights, fine breakfasts (great cappacino machine), ideal location near Gard L'Est so touring was very easy, etc. Of our 3 European hotels on this trip (also Berlin and Rome), this was #1. Also, excellent restaurant down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Served us very well”
Reviews.Author: Thomas E
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to train station. Quiet canal neighborhood and park. Front door secured at night. Clean and comfortable. Friendly and informed helpful staff that was always available. Even packed food for our return plane trip without a request from us! Nice breakfast area also available as meeting place throughout the day. Full self serve breakfast with later bar service. Newspaper available daily. Family owned and operated by same family for over 10 years. Tiny rooms, and even smaller bath and shower. If stairs are a problem for you, ask for a lift side room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: smokie84
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in july for 4 nights. prior to the stay my husband emailed hotel to say would be my birthday whilst we were there,. upon arrival we were upgraded rooms, had a lovely view of the Gare d L'est station. STAFF WERE AMAZING, so helpful and friendly. we have travelled extensively and must say they were the best we have ever had. i forgot a travel plug so they gave us one to borrow, we needed help to reprint our boarding passes and again they did this for us with no bother, and we took back a pizza one night and were offered plates, cutlery etc so we could eat it comfortably in our room., our television wouldnt work and the reception came up straight away and fixed it. hotel is situated in lovely quiet street, very close to open top bus tour stop and very close to metro station. there are mcdonalds etc close by and french restaurants too. bedrooms werent huge but adequate for our stay, i would agree that a kettle etc would have been ideal in the room. everything was very clean in the hotel, and breakfast was the usual continental style, but had plenty to choose from.would definately recommend this hotel and would definately stay here if we went back to paris. a fantastic find, booked through hotels4u, got a great price too!!!

Reviews.Title: “I really love this place..very convenient ..!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage67
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not so big, but the quality of the bed is second to none, I do have a tempurpedic mattress and the difference was minimum, the street was pretty much not noisy at all, excellent breakfast too..!! and the ice on the cake is excellent service and gare do nord ...the train and metro stations are only 2 blocks away..... very important in Paris...!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff are absolute stars.”
Reviews.Author: jordanacjordan
Reviews.Content: We just love this hotel,especially the staff. Only minus no tea making facilities this time. Will stay again (with a travel kettle)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we intend being back as soon as possible!”
Reviews.Author: amolin2009
Reviews.Content: Me, Daniel, and my friend Ronaldo (brazilian guys) have been at Villa Saint Martin Hotel on our last hollydays, on July, 2011, and wish thank the management and especially the receptionists for all the attention they spent us! All the girls were patient, polite and kind with us! Besides they are so beautiful girls!!! Comfortable room and complete breakfast! What else can we wish for ourselves? We have had the best impressions of Paris!!! It is going to be an unforgettable trip! Oh la la, France!!! If you wish to contact us, the email address is: amolin2009@hotmail.com Best wishes!!! Thanks for everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel I've been near Gare du Nord”
Reviews.Author: AgentP13
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at Villa Saint Martin. T The location is perfect when travelling by train. The hotel is clean throughout, and we were very happy with the room. I have to say that for the many times I have been to Paris and have stayed in may different hotels, the staff at this hotel were exceptionally friendly and always helpful. At reception they will speak in French, English and Spanish and still being friendly...I have not experienced that in Paris before!! I will be back definitely! merci

Reviews.Title: “Best service EVER”
Reviews.Author: Lene1982
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Villa Saint Martin - and I loved it was near Gare de l'est - so I could hop on and off the metro. Wonderful and helpful staff. And breakfast is worth getting up for. I will definitely stay there again next time I visit Paris. Tanks for a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but is out of the way from most well known tourist points”
Reviews.Author: Merlot2010
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here on our first trip to Paris. It is closest to Gare de l"Est but not far from Gare de Nord so walking to and from the train station is not an issue. The hotel was clean and safe and the staff was lovely & helpful. It was cool to be right near the oldest church in Paris although occasionally you hear a little noise from the work they were doing on the church. The priest was in front of the church mingling with the locals each time we came by which added some charm to the area. The rooms were clean and neat but are very small for most US standards so get over yourself! The elevator is also small so beware of having lots of luggage. The underground stop is within easy walking distance. Even closer is a stop for one of the tourist bus lines so we bought a two day ticket and used it for most all of our movement. The only negative is that the drivers DO NOT stick to the schedule so you can lose some time waiting if you are on a tight schedule. Hey, its vacation - loosen up. :) The continental breakfasts provided a wide variety and started your days off well. Restaurants in the area are geared more for evenings and the typically larger, French dinner menu so for those looking for lighter fare, especially during the day will be challenged.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: synnyster
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at Villa Saint Martin in March with my wife. The hotel itself is on the small side, but that is what you expect in Paris. The room was very nice for the price. The breakfast was included in our price and was good. The hotel is located near 2 main train stations so it is a good area if you wanting to make a day trip out of Paris or just moving on to your next destination. Many of the main attractions are about a 30 minute walk from the hotel if you are up for it. Subway stations can be found near as well.

Reviews.Title: “When we return to Paris, this is the only place we will stay.”
Reviews.Author: wvulaw
Reviews.Content: The staff here was amazing. The girls that worked behind the desk were very pleasant and helped us with directions, questions, concerns, and our terrible handle on the French language. The location is a 3 minute walk from Gare de l'Est which is a train and metro stop. Although not near any of the major land marks in Paris, there is a beautiful canal, Canal St. Martin, just down the road a block or two, and with the metro stop that close it is a quick trip to any of the sightseeing landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, and others. Our room was what we expected in size and cleanliness, but was also air-conditioned which we were not expecting. All in all, we had a wonderful time while in Paris, we will be back and staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kingpete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at the Villa Saint Martin after spending two nights there last year. Room 164 not the biggest but had everything one could reasonably want, including a wonderfully comfortable double bed, effective and quiet air conditioning (very welcome) and a huge LCD TV with 50+ channels. It looked out onto the garden so was really quiet. Breakfast is fairly simple but attractive, fresh and generous; the breakfast room doubles as a welcoming bar later in the day, selling drinks at pub prices. Location is excellent, 5 minutes walk from the Gare d'Est, but better still, at the other end of the street is the super-trendy Canal St Martin - do as we did and enjoy a picnic on a warm evening, but beware, alcohol is only tolerated outside until 9pm. So overall, a brilliant hotel that doesn't try to do anything it can't but does what it does really well. Its best feature though has got to be the friendly, welcoming and helpful staff for whom nothing is too much trouble and who make the place really special - and for only £70 per night including breakfast (via Asda) one of Paris's best bargains!

Reviews.Title: “unbelieveable....”
Reviews.Author: Hardyryan
Reviews.Content: Hai all I just get back from paris holiday, Initially very worried about the hotel in paris, but what a suprise Villa saint martin hotel was the best hotel to me it is because it is very near to Garde de Nord train station whereby if you wish to get back by Eurostar it is the best place to stay no rush because the distance is near. breakfast was great light and easy.... Room is fantastic... you can open the window so that nice air can come in to the room...So romantic for couple..all of you should try...reception was very helpful and very understanding...metro station also nearby....try it our you wont regret guys...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonibologna14
Reviews.Content: The Villa St. Martin was wonderful! The staff was amazingly kind and all spoke excellent English. They were extremely knowledgeable and helped us out so much. Breakfast was delicious!!! So fresh! The location was great; it was down the street from the metro. Super clean rooms. It was just great! I absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Better than most for the money”
Reviews.Author: thesaurus23
Reviews.Content: First room we had in main hotel had a large bed but was cramped over all. It's a quiet area and the reception girls are helpful. We had to move the second night to the older part of building where there isn't a lift, and we were on the top floor. Quiet room, although the back rooms overlook school playing grounds so in the day it's noisy from the children. The room was tiny and chlaustrophobic, the bathroom not bad though. The first night we paid 115 euros which was reasonable but the second night it was 156 euros for some reason, which we felt was expensive for such a tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: toconnor17
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant place to stay in a convenient location just off the Gare de L'Est train station at a price that is reasonable by Paris standards. The staff is very friendly and helpful---I observed them providing assistance to many hotel guests. The rooms are rather large by Paris standards and the bathroom is quite modern and comfortable. The only significant negative is that the walls seem to be paper-thin--I could hear every word of our next door neighbors' morning conversations as well as every noise from their room. If you are wanting quiet and like to sleep in, this could be a problem. Otherwise, thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: great staff!”
Reviews.Author: missmistry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend for 2 nights with my best friend during out city break to Paris. The hotel was presented very well! The staff were so helpful!!!! I couldn't have been happier with the level of service! They were kinda, polite, understanding and were so helpful when asking for things that they even printed information for us. Our room was clean and a good size for what we paid. It was furnished with mod cons incl: new finished bathroom, hair dryer, TV, full length mirror and safe. The area isn't the nicest in Paris but the hotel is 3mins walk from Gard Du Nord which gives you access to anywhere in Paris via the Metro. The hotel also recommended a local restaurant serving French Cuisine 20 ft down the road Les Enfants Perdus which we visited...recommended for diner!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: George60956
Reviews.Content: We will stay here on our next trip to Paris. The English speaking staff provided the best service that anyone could possibly ask for. And a very nice room plus a great breakfast.\ This was our 50th anniversary trip and this hotel was the best. Location is very good, couple of blocks from Metro, plenty of restaurants in neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CypressRidge
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Paris in May 2011 with my spouse and another couple. We stayed at this hotel for five nights. The hotel itself is a typical three-star - small but clean rooms. Breakfast was great. Location near the Gare D'Est train station made travel around the city a breeze even though it is a bit east of key attractions. The Hop-On, Hop-Off bus stop is a block away, too! But what made our stay so delightful is the staff. They were SO responsive, helpful and pleasant. Need a computer to print boarding passes? No problem. They provided a laptop and printing capability. They gave us tips about the best way to get around. Our last day we had a pickup at 6 a.m., but breakfast is not until 6:30 a.m. Sure enough, they had breakfast ready for us a 5:45 a.m. that morning! THAT'S service. There are more than 2,000 hotels in Paris. If you want something homey and special, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Ideallocation for a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: walthersus
Reviews.Content: We have chosen this hotel because of its location close to the “Gare de l’Est” train station. The reception staff was surprisingly young, very friendly and extremely helpful. We stayed in a twin room which was spacious enough for 3 nights. The bathroom was OK but the shower cabin was VERY small! The hairdresser was quite powerful. Breakfast was served in the bar and the quality of food was delicious. They had slices of bread and buns, croissants, meat, cheese, eggs, fruit salad and yogurt. There was also the choice of 2 fruit juices. Coffee was supplied by a machine which produced very delicious Cappuccino. I would alqays choose this hotel again if I went back to Paris one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff. Horrible environment.”
Reviews.Author: Ajones_0319
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel earlier this month. The staff was wonderful--very friendly and helpful. The hotel and the neighborhood were horrible. The rooms were very small (7'x7') which were too small even by European standards. There was mold in the bathroom and brown stains on the bathroom ceiling. The hallways were fitted with lights activated by motion detectors located at only one end of the hallway. You had to walk down a dark hallway in order to turn on the lights and then go back down the hallway to safely exit by elevator or the stairs. The street was more line a dark alley. I saw two dead rats on the sidewalk. Most buildngs on the street were lined with graffiti. I would never recommend this hotel. I give the staff a large BRAVO for working in these conditions and for their great care for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely best choise”
Reviews.Author: Zlatan78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here five days and my impressions are really great! The hotel has nice position, 2 minutes on foot from metro station Gare de l'Est! My room was very clean with nice bathroom! Breakfast is surprisingly good and with several french cheese! The thing I like the most is kindness of hotel stuff. They were always prepared to give me every information I need, especially Benedicte, who had nerves for my bad french!Besides,all of them speak english very well a part from majority of french people in the streets,bars,shops. My recommends goes to this hotel for sure! And will come again! Zlatan

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Gare de l'Est and canal”
Reviews.Author: MandLGloucester
Reviews.Content: Very convenient if arriving or departing from Gare de l'Est. Pleasant location near park and canal with some good restaurants and bars near by. Superior room was very spacious. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Took my daugther to Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: southernguyFL
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff very helpful and great personality. The hotel location was very close to metro. The walk from the metro to the hotel was a little concerning at first, but afterward I felt safe enough to return last nights with my daughter. The opposite direction from the hotel towards the river was safe and in a middle-class neighbor. The room was very nice for European standards. Nice for under $150 per night. We stayed 8 nights. Bathroon toilet was a bit close the wall and the shower

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajbauer29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while in Paris and couldn't be happier. Though located in kind of a seedy area near the train station, it was a great location because it was right next to a metro stop and you could get anywhere quickly. The staff was outstanding- so incredibly nice and helpful- their English is impeccable! The breakfast served each morning is huge and delicious- not just croissants and coffee, but cereal, yogurt, meats, cheeses, eggs, a variety of rolls, fresh fruit...just wonderful. There is a really nice restaurant nearby that serves this incredible ravioli with goat cheese in this beef broth that is absolutely to die for. Terrific recommendation by the staff. Again, we couldn't be happier. Good shower, bed was comfortable. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What April in Paris Should Be”
Reviews.Author: JRErnest
Reviews.Content: The Villa Saint Martin is nicely located, serves a great breakfast, and is comfortable and convenient--but the best thing is the service. The staff is simply outstanding, helpful in every way and genuinely solicitous, looking for every way to make your visit more comfortable and enjoyable. We recommend this hotel to anyone, and we'll stay there the next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It...”
Reviews.Author: Mike32679
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny, but cute, cute, cute with large wonderful windows that opened wide. The people on staff were so nice, helpful, courteous, sweet. Near a nice park, two major rail stations and subway access. We loved it. Ask the desk about neighborhood grocery stores. You can get a substantial wedge of brie for about 2 euros and a great bottle of wine for 4 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful-friendly staff-”
Reviews.Author: 2ticos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a package and therefore cannot comment on the price/value equation. The hotel is located off the beaten path, but with the excellent subway system in Paris, you can practically stay anywhere as long as there is a station nearby. The metro is 2 blocks away from the Gare de l'est and a few more from the Gare du Nord. We have a room facing the front of the hotel on the second floor - The street is not very busy and the room was very quite. The room was tight but comfortable, clean and well decorated with nice comfortable bedding. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of offerings. The staff was always helpful and greated us with a friendly smile. I would consider this hotel in my future travels and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Good security and Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Astaris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We came from Switzerland via train and it was about 3 mins walking distance from station n Gare De L'est Metro. Direct Metro to major sightseeing places and shopping areas. Love love love the location. As previous posts have said, its clean, compact and ideal if your looking a hotel on a budget. All the receptionist was extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast was great too! We would certainly go back...can't highly recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonble stay at Villa Saint Martin”
Reviews.Author: pontypandy57
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at this hotel and the staff were very helpful and obliging and spoke excellent english, our room was compact and bejue as they say, the bathroom was a little on the cramped size and the shower cubicle was extremely tight to get in and out of, I don`t know how larger people managed and there was a few larger americans staying here. The breakfast was continental with plenty of choice as long as you got down there early, the bar serviced as the restaurant and was a little overcrowded some mornings. The hotel tried really hard and fair play was clean and tidy and as I say the staff were brilliant and keen to help, the location was north east of the seine approx 45 mins walk to the Notre Dam cathedral and about 400mts from Garde L`Este Metro station. Plenty of cafe bars close by albeit they were a little expensive e.g. meal for 2 costs around 45 Euros, beer was 8 Euros a pint, in the hotel a bottle of wine was 12Euros 50Cents, which, was the cheapest we could find although the bar was dead in the evenings. My only complaint about the hotel was there was a persistent smell of smoke in our room although it was a non smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: BonnieMax
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room 111, this is meant to be a little larger than a standard room. I choose this hotel because of the location to the main train stations.The front desk staff were excellent and always friendly and very personal. The rooms are basic with a large LCD TV and a modern bathroom. The ceiling in the bathroom was quite low, that if your are over 184 cms you would have to duck your head while having a shower. The bath towels were a good size and thick. The walls were very thin, I could hear the people in the next room easily. The free WiFi worked well in our room. This is a nice basic hotel for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris weekend”
Reviews.Author: crystal64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in room 268 which was to the back with 2 flights of stairs no lift but the standard of the room was good and shower fantastic. The cleaner does a great job and they never get thanked properly. The breakfast is cereal fresh fruit yogurt rolls croissants bread cheese cold meat jam nutella orange juice coffee selection of teas. The gard du nord is a 10 minute walk and gard du l'est station is just round the corner. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful and speak excellent english would definely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “First time to Paris, very very pleased”
Reviews.Author: ingmarsvenson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The service was polite and friendly and very helpful (and all spoke English, which was quite helpful, though I hate to admit it). It was a five minute walk from Gare du Nord, and seconds from Gare de l'Est. Free internet worked well (unlike all other hotels this trip), and room was very clean and sleek/modern. One last tiny thing I noted: the candy at the front desk was delicious. Will do my best to stay here on any subsequent trips to Paris. Stay here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, good value and excellent front desk service”
Reviews.Author: EddieNiagara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa Saint-Martin as part of a tour package. The hotel is a good solid choice. As with any hotel in Paris, rooms are a little on the small side but have all the amenities. I was in a single, which had a recent reno of the bathroom. Shower was very small, I am 6' 3", and could barely fit, but the bathroom was very clean. In the main part of the room, there is barely enough room for the double bed, but again, it was quite clean and I did have a small closet and a desk from which to work. My wife and daughter were in a double room, which was a little larger and had a recent reno on the bathroom as well. Again, size being what it is in Paris, the tub was so small that I could not fit and my wife and daughter could barely fit. Nonetheless, it is a clean and nice hotel. Location, while not that near the downtown, is literally across the road from Gare de L'Est, a main train station and a stop on the Metro. The Metro, is excellent and easy to follow and get arpouind as a mode of transportation. We bought a 5 day pass for each of the three of us on the Metro for 90 Euros and used the Metro continuously. You can generally speaking get anyhwhere in Paris using the Metro. The breakfast was nioce, not to over the top, but fairly good choices were available. Our biggest thanks went to the front desk staff, Charlotte especially, but also Marianna, Benedicte and Veronique. On the whole, Parisiens are not that friendly or service oriented, but the front desk staff was excellent. They took care of every request and wish easily and with a smile. In fact, we had our passports stolen (watch out for pickpockets in Paris - very bad) and the assistance from the front desk staff was outstanding. It would have been very difficult to coordinate all the phone calls, etc. without their assitance. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: ducos
Reviews.Content: On my way back from Le Mans, I decided to stop for couple of days in Paris and I booked one at La Villa Saint Martin Hotel, which very convenient located, near Gare de L'Est and Gare du Nord and from there easy acces to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport. I am very happy with my choice. If you are after luxury, you wouldn't want to stay there, as the hotel has very basic facilities, however if you want a spotless clean room, nice breakfast and a very warm welcome, then this hotel is the perfect choise. Unfortunatelly I did not take the name of the girl who was in reception when I arrived, as she was not wearing a name badge, but she was very welcoming and helpfull and on top of that her english was just perfect. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone, who doesn't want to spend too much, but still getting a very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MyT9
Reviews.Content: If you look out on the internet, you can find great deals for this hotel, which are close to being unbeatable taking into account value for money. Do not expect a posh hotel with large luxurious rooms. Villa Saint Martin offers decent rooms of an acceptable size, which are 'nicely' decorated. So, nothing outrageous but very ordinary. The breakfast is better than at most Parisian hotels as there is a fairly wide choice of products, and the quality is definitely above average. The staff are multilingual and seem very nice. The area is not the best: it is very near to the train station Gare de l'Est which is nice to get around town, but on the other hand: train stations are usually not in the best areas (expect night shops and old cafés closeby instead of Louis Vuiton and YSL). Bathroom looks quite nice and very clean (products are by Yves Rocher). The mattresses on the beds are a bit hard. In short, this is a very good 3-star quality hotel, close to unbeatable in value for money. Do not expect full luxury though.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: lymac7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! It was close to good restaurants and brasseries, and very close to Gare de l'Est, which made it easy for the traveler to get around the city. Like another reviewer said, Charlotte was very friendly and helpful. Actually, all of the desk staff were that way. Their breakfast was good and offered a lot of variety, and the rooms were clean and well maintained. Also, the price was reasonable. I recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1978a
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents to this hotel as a Christmas Present A lot of hotels in Paris do not have a good writes up however this one I came across finally did. Its not in the centre as such because Paris is so big, it still does have a centre Paris Postcode if you are using shuttles or private taxi. Its 2 minute walk from the gare de nord and the metro so all the sites and attractions are easy to get to. Rooms are small but clean and tidy. The continental breakfast has a really good selection. My parents loved it, the staff are really helpful and nothing is to much trouble. They would recommend it as a good base to explore a lovely city

Reviews.Title: “This Place Was Great and Service Amazing Will Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: AMAlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My boyriend and I went last week - just got back yesterday. I loved this place and the location by the two train stations (Nord and l'Est) is really good. The staff could not have been more fantastic - especially my favorite Charlotte. She was always there, so very nice and helpful. They were all nice and helpful and my French is the worst but they all spoke English. The room was small but this is Europe and the shower small but nice and hot and had the car washer type spouts that get you everywhere. Felt really good. We were supposed to stay only three nights and then fly to Rome but due to me getting sick (not from Paris but from something going around at my job) we had to cancel as i could not leave the room not fly. Although the hotel was fully booked they went out of there way to allow us to keep our room and could not have been nicer in asking us whatever they could do for us. Again Charlotte saved the day. Breakfast was good and plenty there. I will stay here agian and tell all i know to do so. go to theCana;StMartin at the end of the block - it's really nice andsupermarket on other side.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Treeflynn
Reviews.Content: The only complaint was the room was very small,but the bed was very comfortable . Very helpful staff printed my boarding card for me next morning , close to Gard'Est train station and ten to fifteen mins walk from Gare du Nord train station. Quiet area very nice resturant on same street called Les enfants perdus

Reviews.Title: “Good until they threw my stuff out...”
Reviews.Author: babygat
Reviews.Content: Overall was a good experience. Staff were friendly and the reception was open 24 hours. Don't expect anything special for breakfast but rooms were nice, clean and cosy. Good experience but warning as they do not do late check outs. We booked through BA and requested this however was not told until we returned and our stuff were in storage along with my broken snowglobe that I had brought for 20euros the day before!!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JMSWrexham
Reviews.Content: The staff on reception were friendly, welcoming & helpful and managed to book us a restaurant for dinner that evening, "Les Enfants Perdu" close by, and we had a lovely meal although it was extremely busy being Valentine's Day. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable and we were happy with our room on the fifth floor, although it was on the small side. The double glazing kept out the street noise very efficiently - views of the Gare du l'Est and a nearby park. The only noise was from our neighbours in the next room who tended to slam doors and talk at full volume! Buffet breakfast was included with a good range of fruit, cereals, yoghurt, eggs, meats &cheeses, bread and pastries - help yourselves. The hotel was well situated for arriving by train - Charles De Gaulle airport then RER to Gare du Nord (half an hour, 8.70 euros each way) then one stop on the metro to Gare du l'Est or an easy 10 -15 minute walk. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: cailc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was very pleased with my experience. The service was fantastic. I am an American who speaks VERY LITTLE French, but I had no trouble communicating with those who worked there. They were always available, no matter what the time. Whether it was buying a glass of wine at 3AM for jet lag, or getting an ice pack (I fell walking the Champs Elysees--very character building), the staff was always obliging and helpful.
