It's also in a very convenient location, close to a main travel station. This hotel comes with my enthusiastic recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and easy walking distance of Canal St Martin”
Reviews.Author: AJones1949
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in this hotel despite room being quite small. Whilst slightly outside centre of Paris,it was close to Gare De L'Est for metro and on direct bus route to airport.(number 350).Also within easy walking distance of Canal St Martin with pleasant walk to nearby restaurants. Nearest one is expensive Les Enfants Perdus but wonderful and their lunch at 18 euros is a dream. Hotel staff are very pleasant and helpful and if we were to be critical the plumbing seemed to be noisy and as we were in the basement sounded like Niagara Falls. The breakfast room also is rather cramped for the number of clients in the hotel albeit the breakfast especially the coffee was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutey great !!!”
Reviews.Author: Romuald78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Europe and I can say without a doubt that here I have received the most warm welcome from the reception staff of all. Not even in 5* hotels staff was that friendly and helpful. Regarding the hotel I must say that in my opinion it offers more than a fair value for a 3* property - a good location with Gare de l'Est 3 minutes away walking and from there excellent conections to everywhere in Paris, clean, chic and functional rooms, with everything in the right place. Breakfast was good, nothing special to say here. My wife felt in love with the mattress of our bed, so soft and relaxing, just perfect after a day of walking in Paris. I would like to thank once more to Benedicte and her colleagues from the reception - they made our trip so much pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Heatherjayne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with otel.com and got one night free, thought it was great value for a city hotel. Staff were very friendly, room was clean and it's just a short walk from the metro. Realised after we left that we hadn't filled in any type of feedback form, main suggestion would be for them to display a five day weather forecast print out in the reception, which would have been useful for us in planning our days. All in all though somewhere I'd definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel near the Gare de L'Est”
Reviews.Author: ColinBern
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice recently and find it to be an excellent choice. Its location near both the Gare de L'Est and the Gard du Nord is very convenient for us as we arrive by Eurostar and travel onwards by TGV to Switzerland. The rooms are small, as are most in Paris, but clean with a good bathroom and shower. The breakfast is good but possibly the best feature is the staff. They are polite and helpful, speak good English and do not sneer at our attempts to speak French, something we have encountered in other Parisian hotels. The hotel is in a side street which is surprisingly quiet for one so close to the main stations. We have already booked for ourselves and friends for next July.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: Gorale
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights with my wife. Excellently located hotel, close to both Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est stations so you have all your connections near by. Also it is on a quiet street, so good for your sleep. Our room was on a first floor and rather small, with even smaller bathroom. good that we both are slim and small :) otherwise it would be difficult to get into shower. Because we were during low season, hotel was not full, but when it is you might have some noisy neighbors, as the isolation is poor, and one can hear almost everything outside of the room. Breakfast is decent, not so much choice, but all is tasty. We also enjoyed free Wi- Fi throughout the hotel. All in all, we liked it and would definitely stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Dentalfreak11
Reviews.Content: Lovely place! The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are very modern. The breakfast buffet is very good, and features a cappucino machine that can make you a latte hot chocolate. The employees were wonderful and helpful, as was the view. I will definetely return. Also, please ask Benedict if he remembers the girls who asked him for spoons every night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JalanHidup
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night only before leaving Paris on 21 Jan. Didn't realise that this hotel is only 2min walk to Canal St Martin. We walked to canal under the full moon while looking for place to have dinner (plenty restaurants nearby). Room was quite big and had great hot shower. It was on quiet street, which was helpful for good resting night. Staff was very helpful. Train station Gare de L'est is only 2 min walking distance. Really recommended to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: mermaid_cat
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location - 10 minutes from eurostar, 3 minutes from gare de l'est which is connected to 3 metro lines. Friendly receptionist and staff generally. My room was small but had everything you need anad very clean. Very quiet as I was at the back of the hotel, I could even sleep with my window open as it was a bit stuffy in the room - pretty amazing how quiet it was even with the window open, in January too! I had a problem ith the bathroom, a slight leak from the cieling which was sorted out immediately by a very friendly guy. All in all a great stay in a great location, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent friendly and accomodating place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy43323
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. My wife and I stayed for three nights. The hotel is located very close to the train station. Also one of the Paris bus tours has a stop a block away so the Louvre, Effiel Tower, Norte Dame, etc. are easily accessible if you're a first time Paris visitor. The hotel is clean. The staff is very friendly and very willing to help with any question or need. The neighborhood has many nice restaurants. The breakfast served at the hotel was excellent and tasty. We would definitely stay here again. We also would have no problem recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “5 star Family Hotel! ~~Suitable for everyone! Will definitely stay here again! :)”
Reviews.Author: AydaHabs
Reviews.Content: I have actually started boasting about this hotel to friends and families. Well, mainly because this hotel has been amazing to me. An experience to remember forever! I am a breastfeeding mom and travelled without my baby. Hence i had to express breast milk every day and seek help from the reception to help store my milk in their freezer.(there was no fridge in the room) I had to 'bother' them everyday to assist but it seems that this is not even an issue. The ladies understood my situation and gladly assisted without any questions. Check in was not until 2pm but i had to express some milk. The kind lady at recep was kind enough to offer me a room that is ready on the 1st floor before 2pm. I did not mind of course. I really appreciate her kind understanding. Everyday i see different faces at reception and these smiley faces provide service that i can safely label as high class service. Here are the main areas which I can commend::: Reception: ALL and i mean ALL of them were fluent in English. They were mainly ladies and they were cheerful and super friendly and helpful and POLITE! :)) Room: VERY clean and comfortable. Bathroom: was not expecting a fancy one but this hotel bathroom provides stylish shower area with massage and 2 different shower heads AND a nice and clean wash basin area. Free shower soap and lotion also provided. The towels were thick and really absorbent and good. View: We were on the 1st floor and looking out the window we could see some shrubs but that did not bother me and my bro at all. when it is warm at night,we would leave the window ajar for a while to let the cool air in. Location: Very near Gare del Est metro,barely 5 mins walk and there are cafes and shops all around. surprising that area is not noisy and disturbing. Safe outlook, fret not! If you are looking for halal food, just walk around the corner and you will find kebab joints. 1 that we ate at actually closes at 12 midnight. Beside the hotel is a bookshop and a graffiti shop and also near a shop selling arms. Interesting... :) Breakfast: Bread, fruits, yogurt,freshly baked croissants ans chocolate pastries,cheese slices,and some meat slices. They have a stylish espresso machine. You can even make yourself a hot chocolate! Cool! Definitely will not consider staying anywhere else but here! booked online and got the best price (winter season) including breakfast. At 54eur per night with that kind of service, i feel Paris is allll LOVE....Go for it! :))

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly stopover near the northern stations”
Reviews.Author: amy000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here en route from Italy to the UK and it is a very nice, friendly no frills hotel, within sight of Gare d'est and ten minutes walk from the Gard d'nord. Hotel has no restaurant but there were some nice looking bistros down towards the San Martin canal ( which was disappointingly drab itself) although they did not serve food until late and we wanted to eat. Other nearby options are fast food places around the station area if you want to eat early. The hotel has a small bar, which is also the breakfast room - nice plain food, drinks from a machine but nice enough. Only problem is the chairs are all bolted to the floor and not quite right with the tables - well, I suppose they must be in the right place for some people ! The room was small and I wouldn't want more than a night there but it was comfortable and clean and everything worked OK ! There were no large towels when we arrived and we wondered if this was part of the deal, but a simple request had towels delivered toute suite. No language problems, the staff were charming. Only thing I hated were the dirty streets on the walk to the station - cigarette ends, dog dirt. On our trip across Europe by train, walking from hotel to stations in several cities, this was the dirtiest route.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel + helpful staff = a nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Sud
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Villa St Martin for 5 days in December. It was our first wedding anniversary and the hotel was perfect for our stay. It is situated a five minute walk from Gare de L'est and so is ideally located for anyone arriving by either Eurostar (as we did) or by plane as CDG and Orly airport both have direct links to this station. There is also a Metro on the road opposite the hotel. I had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to inform them of our wedding anniversary and upon arrival we had been upgraded to a better room as a result - this was very kind of the hotel and it was a nice start to our anniversary trip. The room itself was spacious and the bathroom was a nice size, the hotel provided nice, good quality complimentary toiletries (not the bog standard) which was also a nice touch. The television in the room only had one english speaking channel - CNN - which is annoying to the point of irritation (the channel!) so it was a good thing that the television wasn't charged to the room as an extra! I only add this point as information for any english speaking people looking to book the room, but to be honest after a day's sightseeing we were always too exhausted to watch tv anyway! The only negative I could say about this hotel would be the thin-ness of the walls - we literally heard the conversations and toilet habits of the two adjoining rooms - as a result we spoke in whispers most of the time - the window's are double glazed and so we heard little or no outside noise at all - I don't suppose anything can be done about this but then again, the hotel should really only be used as a stop-gap in between sight seeing so I guess it would only really irritate you if you spent a long time in your room? That said, compared to other hotels in Paris, this one offered extremely friendly and helpful staff and a good sized room.. It was very reasonable price wise and worked extremely well for us location wise so we were able to make the best use of the time we had there. If we ever returned to Paris I would not hesitate in booking this hotel again. We never got up for breakfast so i cannot comment on the quality of the food on offer. We ate locally one night and at Bistro 31 on the night of our anniversary (fabulous food and surroundings..cannot recommend it enough) we ate at a chinese resteraunt another night which was pleasant enough and made do with sandwiches and portable food the rest of the time. I would recommend to all to purchase your tickets for the Eiffel Tower online prior to leaving, this avoids you having to queue for hours and ensures you are able to access the tower quickly and easily (at your agreed time of booking) it also lessen's the time you have to spend avoiding the irritiating street sellers (who all sell exactly the same rubbish souvenirs within feet of each other!) and who continually badger the tourists who are queuing for their tickets! I would also recommend buying the metro and train tickets online prior to arriving, we were able to get off the eurostar and hop on to the metro without having to try and navigate our way through the awkward -ness of trying to buy tickets speaking in broken french/english! Bottom line is that this hotel is well located for travel and for all the sights of Paris that you want to see. The staff are extremely polite and helpful not to mention knowledgable. I would definately recommend this hotel to my friends or family - indeed anyone looking to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: summerchill13
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris on Christmas Eve. We were delighted to find the Villa Saint Martin was located a short walk from the train/metro station. The hotel is delightful. The room was very clean and the rooms were quiet. We slept well each night. The best part about this hotel is the staff. They are warm, welcoming, and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris and will look forward to my next stay at Villa Saint Martin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Aw1989
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to Paris as a surprise for my 21st birthday and we spent 3 nights in this hotel. We got caught up in the bad weather/ Eurostar cues and didn't arrive at the hotel until 3.30am, but luckily we were able to get into our room at this time. Our room (some would say small) and en-suite bathroom was beautiful, there was plenty of room for us and both were incredibly clean. The area was very quite which made for an excellent nights sleep! The staff are wonderfully friendly and are happy to help with any problems you have - personally, I had forgotten a piece of luggage, and that has since been sent back to me. They are polite and there is a family-feel. The breakfast is continental with lots of pastries, meats, cereals and yoghurts, all very nice. My only criticism (although very small) is that the breakfast appeared to be the same each morning which some people may not like. The hotel itself is located about 2 minutes away from the Gard'Est train station, where you can easily catch the metro to anywhere in Paris. I would definetly stay here again, and would highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “super stay 332”
Reviews.Author: scranmaster
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great location, staff were very friendly and helpful, we stayed here over christmas for 3 nights. Will definately stay here again. Super breakfast and well priced drinks list.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: GlennfromAdelaide
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic Hotel. I wish I could use it to advertise Paris to everyone back home. The staff are so very friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble for them. The restaurant is comfortable, breakfast was excellent each day with a large selection of pastries, cereal, breads, fresh fruit salad, meats and cheeses. Fruit juice and tea/coffee also provided. Best value breakfast I have encountered in most places I have travelled. Location is close to everything. Metro (Gare de l'Est) is 2 minutes walk. A selection of restaurants to suit all budgets are similar (try the Indiana on the corner opposite Gare de l'Est for the burgers and Cafe de l'Est just past there for traditional French fare). The walk along Canal St Martin, 2 mins in the opposite direction to the railway station, is spectacular, and typically Parisian. Just wonderful Rooms were traditional Paris, smaller than some cities, but better than I had hoped for. Still very comfortable. Bathroom was a bonus with a 3/4 bath and well appointed. Not huge, but still excellent compared to other Hotels in Paris. If you have an option, ask for a room facing Rue de Recollets, the view is sensational In the middle of a snowy Paris over Christmas/New Year, the rooms were always comfortably warm. I had no problems at all with the a/c, it worked very well. After an initial glitch with the WiFi, which the staff went out of their way to fix, it worked well and was quick and stable. In room TV is mostly French, with CNN in English. One more English speaking (non US)channel would be fantastic, but is only a very very minor point - more a request than a criticism. Lstly, a final mention to the staff, again. They were just great, so very very helpful. Leave all the pre-conceptions about the French attitude behind, these people epitomise service. Thanks for a wonderful stay, we will certainly be back

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Great service”
Reviews.Author: tannythestar
Reviews.Content: Convenient location - near Gare L'Est which is essential for us as we need to catch TGV in the morning hours. Supermarket nearby and short walk to canal St. Martin which is beautiful and relaxing. Staff were really friendly and helpful especially the lady in the hotel restaurant (she gave us ice, etc. and very friendly eventhough she couldn't speak English). Housekeeping staff couldn't speak English either but also very friendly. The room was really clean and has great amenities provided. Bed was comfy. Wifi was fast and we could borrow a laptop anytime if we need it. Good breakfast included too. The only thing bad thing during our stay was the airconditioning that didn't work so well, perhaps (as they explained) because the weather wasn't so hot outside but in the room was very warm during the day and early night. We had to open the window but there were mosquitoes getting in so we had to keep it close.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for location and value”
Reviews.Author: tvmovielover
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night before going on a Seine cruise. Our room was smallish but as said below, we do not lounge in our rooms in a city like Paris. Location is great near both Gare de Nord and Est and many decent small restaurants are nearby. The breakfast was very good. Our only regret was that a week later when we were stranded for 2 extra days by weather, the hotel was already booked and we had to stay elsewhere. We left our luggage early in the am when we arrived in Paris, to go touring and were in the Louvre about 15 minutes after leaving the hotel so do not let its distance from the main sights deter you from staying here. This hotel is great for location and value and we would definitely stay again if reservations were available.

Reviews.Title: “You will NOT regret staying here:) Delightful!!!”
Reviews.Author: marchellene
Reviews.Content: If I could sum the hotel up it would be...customer service is wonderful. The hotel is situated out of the 'center' of Paris but less than a 3 minute walk to the metro station. You can get into the city in less than 15 minutes... We had never been to Paris and were a bit worried about exactly how easy it was to get around. It was NO problem at all. The rooms had modern furnishings, the bed was very comfortable, and the hotel was quiet ( which is a wonderful find in such a busy city!). I am a very light sleeper, and I slept well here. The bathroom was small but according to European standards it was average size. However, we always had a wonderfully hot shower, and great water pressure. Our linens were refreshed daily. The hotel was warm, accommodating, and they spoke perfect English. Oh and FREE INTERNET. We really appreciated that. Kristina was wonderful!! She was one of the staffers that made us reservations at a restaurant we wanted to try. They also arranged our taxi to the airport for an early flight and assisted us with everything we had questions about. My husband and I had a wonderful stay and will return. Thank you Villa St. Martin!!!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value, friendly and helpful staff, convenient location ... we recommend Villa Saint Martin!”
Reviews.Author: 1oldguitarman
Reviews.Content: My wife & I celebrated our 40th anniversary with a Paris & London trip. Villa Saint Martin was an excellent value and we were very pleased. The rooms are modestly-sized, but more than adequate. We didn't come to Paris to lounge in our room. The breakfasts were good with a reasonable selection of items. It wasn't the Cracker Barrel "Country Boy Breakfast" which makes us Americans so obese, but the quality & range of selections was very good & healthy. All of the front desk staff were excellent: friendly, helpful and with a good command of English. Location is 1.5 blocks from Gare de l'Est, one of the major metro(subway) and rail stations ... with a 2-minute walk, you can be there & use the metro to get anywhere in Paris (just a few minutes & you're downtown). We had no concerns with safety. Some reviews and tourist guides give this region (arondissement) of Paris a slight disadvantage for security ... but we walked the area very late on several nights and felt no concerns. HELPFUL HINT: if you're a tourist, for your first trip to the metro station, make sure you walk there and immediately BACK to Villa St. Martin. Our first day, we returned very late from the Louvre and made one wrong turn when leaving Gare de l'Est ... we walked a good mile before finding our way! After that one instance, Villa St. Martin was always very easy to locate from Gare de l'Est. We would definitely consider this hotel for our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: othmane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in NOV 2010, I will have no problem recommending this property, location is great very close to LA GARE DE L'EST and LA GARE DU NORD Checked in in the evening and it was quick , rooms are very clean and spacious, loved the massive flat screen tv, bathroom is lovely, clean with excellent Yves Rocher hygiene products. Checked out early at 6h00 am before breakfast starts and the night recpetionist offered me some nice croissants and a glass of orange juice ( I've been in some hotels of similar standard where hotel staff just put you off by saying breakfast is not served yet ) Overall, very good experience and an excellent hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: AZEuroTraveler
Reviews.Content: Like many travelers, I relied on customers' previous reviews before deciding to stay at this hotel...and I wasn't disappointed. This small, but very clean hotel is located on a quiet street at the 10th arrondissement, with Gare de l'Est Metro station within a short walk from the hotel. The buffet-style breakfast was more than expected - pastries, cereal, orange juice, eggs, cold cut meats, etc. and multiple-choices of prepare your own hot drinks from their automatic espresso machine. The staff provided excellent customer service. They will provide a laptop for guests to use if you ask - yes, at no charge. "Les Enfants Perdus" restaurant located a few feet away from the hotel, was an excellent recommendation to hotel guests. The restaurant's food was delicious & the staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff, very friendly..top notch”
Reviews.Author: Chaps5
Reviews.Content: Free Wi-fi, clean, good breakfast. Front Desk was exceptional. We went from rome to florence to paris and this hotel was by far the best. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: staciegwiz
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel - the room size was larger than expected and the bathroom was fantastic! the shower was amazing. we had the king bed and were pleasantly surpised that there were two duvets in the closet, so we each got our own blanket. the room temp was the only problem - it was SO hot. we tried to move the thermostat down but it stayed hot the whole time. ended up needing to open the window. the staff was so friendly and tolerant of our lack of ability to speak French. we got there several hours before check-in and they kept our luggage for us so that we could wander around the city until our room was ready. the hotel itself is very close to a large Metro stop, and in wandering around the area there is plenty of shopping and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: ukausexpat
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but very clean. Staff were incredibly helpful. Perfect location - mere minutes from Gare de l'Est station, surrounded by conveniences (supermarkets, pharmacies etc) and nearby to a small park and canal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, good breakfasts, and good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: paulhb
Reviews.Content: I'd been to Paris before, so my expectations were low. However, when we checked in to Villa Saint Martin, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is only a few minutes' walk from Gare de L'Est (we walked with all of our baggage). The neighbourhood is quintessential Paris, and being close to Gare de L'Est means you can get anywhere really quickly. We stayed almost a week, and got aroudn the neighbourhood quite a bit. The staff were amazing - not all of them spoke English well (which you can't really expect in Paris), but they were always friendly and did their best to help. Every request we had was taken care of. The rooms were large by Paris standards, and quite comfortable. Probably the only item I can fault is a problem with the shower that made it difficult to switch on - but this wasn't too laborious. Breakfasts were really good - buffet style with plenty of French fare (cheeses, fruits, pastries, etc). Oh yes, nearly forgot - free WiFi, and it works really well. Next time I'm in Paris, I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: SnoSearchT
Reviews.Content: First time traveling to Paris on a package deal, the Villa St. Martin was the hotel we selected due to previous reviews here, and we were happily not disappointed. Great proximity to the train stations, and off the beaten tourist path (both pluses). Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Room 445 was on the small side (imagine a nice cruise-ship stateroom), but with plenty of room for our carry-on luggage & then-some. The twin room beds were extremely comfortable, with 2 windows opening to the street. The bathroom was nicely appointed as well. Everything in the hotel was impeccably clean. (Friends traveling with us stayed at the Westin, and their view was of other hotel windows, not to mention the Westin lobby smelled of sewer-gas). Breakfast was fantastic. If you are trying to decide whether or not to stay here (like I was initially), I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place?”
Reviews.Author: TCLP2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a week or so ago. We paid for a superior room which we were told was a larger room with a view...first tip of advice - unless you want a bigger shower go for the regular room (I blame my travel agent for misleading me and not the hotel). Our "superior" room was in a corner with only one window which we had to leave open every night because it was so hot in our room (no AC, I know this is normal, just letting you know about the window). The bathroom was really nice in this room though but again save your money - my opinion. I even inquired at the reception as to the "superior" difference and she seemed flustered and did not understand me so I did not insist as HEY, we were on vacation and I argue enough at work, ha ha. We ended up staying here two more nights due to the strike and we loved the regular room we had (this is why I think the difference is the bathroom). It was larger and had three windows viewing the street so it was nice and cool. The shower was so tiny but I know this is normal for Europe...made for good entertainment hearing my husband hit the walls over and over again during his shower. I would say it is about 2ft x 2ft? Most of the staff was friendly though some did not understand or could communicate in English very well but I do not blame them as we are in THEIR country. Only one of the staff members rubbed me the wrong way because he provided misleading information and I told him so. There is a grocery store a couple of blocks down and he insisted they were all far away and suggested we buy water from their bar instead. The blonde lady with the glasses (sorry we did not get your name) spoke English well and was very helpful. She even let me borrow the phone to call Italy when I had to let them know we would not make it in time due to the strike so THANK YOU! Breakfast is adequate but in my opinion overpriced...go out instead. It is 10 euros per person - meats, cheese, rolls, coffee, yogurt, cereal...Free internet was a HUGE benefit as we ended up spending hours on Skype with our travel insurance after we could not get the phone to work. Their location is right down the street from the station which was PERFECT though next time I think we will stay over by the Luxembourg/Saint Michel area if we return but we would consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: pjmk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and enjoyed our visit. The continental breakfast was wonderful and the rooms were small which is typical but nicely furnished and very clean. The hotel was a short walk to the metro. It was a very good value and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect stay for a few days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HnHsoulier
Reviews.Content: Traveling with thalys from Rotterdam to Gare de Nord, the destination on a monday afternoon. Using a small map walking to the Villa Saint Martin within 5 minutes. A Warm welcome by a quality receptionist. The room on the second floor. Nice facilities. Clean and neat. The Hotel is located at the 10th arrondissement. Near to Metro and other good facilities. Nice neighbourhood, many good native restaurants and bistro and bars. A Perfect stay for a few days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: ross005
Reviews.Content: positives: good location close to 2 major transportation hubs great breakfast free wifi friendly staff good value nice area with grocery stores, etc negatives: beds are not supercomfortable tv is only in french no fridge in the room

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent service, free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: HMSoon
Reviews.Content: Villa St. Martin is a charming 3-star hotel located just a block from the Gare de l'Est metro station. The room we stayed in was modern, recently renovated, well-equipped, and very clean. It's two windows opened onto the street with views of an across-the-street park. The bathroom was small but adequate with clean towels provided daily. The continental breakfast (included with our room) was adequate. Fresh breads, pastries, and fruit were offered in addition to cheeses, cereal, juice and milk. We stayed here for three nights before taking the train to Annecy. Upon our return, Villa St. Martin upgraded us (because it was our wedding anniversary) to their recently opened 4-star hotel, Secret de Paris. Although we wouldn't be able to afford to stay in Secret de Paris if we return to Paris, we will certainly be happy to stay in Villa St. Martin again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a mass of humanity and beauty”
Reviews.Author: RetiredCombineTexan
Reviews.Content: Our first trip overseas and thanks to Travel Advisor we found a great hotel for us to relax and get a good nights rest. Couldn't have ask for a nicer hotel for the price. American style rooms with our own bathroom. P.S. The continental breakfast is not included in the price of the room. It cost $10 each. I should have asked and I might have got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpfull staff, room was comfortable, breakfast-excellent”
Reviews.Author: Europe333
Reviews.Content: Good location-close to Metro, easy access to different areas of Paris, even you have a broad range of interests- sightseeing. Staff: informative, friendly and helpfull people. Room: You have everything necessary to fill comfortable and able to rest. Breakfast: A various of food for different taste.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and distressed to be turned away at 10pm (our room was pre-paid)”
Reviews.Author: Seabrook29
Reviews.Content: I arranged to stay at this hotel as a stopover on our way to and back from Switzerland. Our first stay was good, the hotel is well placed near the Gare de l'est and canal st martin. Our room was up a spiral staircase with no lift which was a little disappointing for a 3 star hotel. The room was very small, but clean and well decorated. So on our return I was quite looking forward to staying there again. We arrived late and exhausted after a very long journey, I had considered ringing to say we would be late, but thought, as the room was pre-paid and we had stayed earlier that week there shouldn't be any problem. When we arrived we were told that they were overbooked and they had booked us into a similar hotel in the Gare de l'est. I was far too tired to get angry, so handed over my hotel voucher (at the receptionist's request) and walked back to the station. The receptionist was not particularly apolygetic or helpful. The hotel we had been booked in was seemed scruffy in comparison, with a slightly surly receptionist and is certainly not somewhere I would have booked myself. I was very upset at the time and wished I had had the energy to get annoyed and express this at the time. I also wished I had kep my voucher, as the 2nd hotel demanded this at first, and I realised that I had given any proof of my payment away leaving us to feel very vulnerable. Reading prevoius reviews I see thgis situation has happened before, and I think that this hotel may do this a lot. Considering I booked and paid in advance I think this is inexcusible.

Reviews.Title: “At least they tried...”
Reviews.Author: TravelDarling23
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Europe and Paris was one of my stops. I had never been there before and was SO excited to go. Well, I got off the Metro at Gare du l'Est, which is a two minute walk from Villa St. Martin -excellent, except I got off the Metro when it was getting dark, with my suitcase in an unfamiliar neighborhood. My immediate impression: wow, this neighborhood is seedy. Besides the general uncleanliness of the city (and I'm from NY), there were quite a few strange men on the short walk to the hotel. Women, just be careful if you are walking about this area by yourself, especially at night. Anyway, we got to our hotel and it was small but welcoming. The reception area is nicely presented and the staff were very nice and answered our questions. One man in particular even looked something up on the internet without us even asking, just so he could assist us. Anyway, we got into the elevator (two petite girls with two suitcases) and squished inside -this elevator is SMALL! We made it to our room, opened the door, and WHAM, the smell hit us instantly. I have to agree with the other reviewers on here -the smell from the canal is VERY unpleasant. We were also greeted by three flies flying around our room -not a good first impression (they were gone the next day and the remaining part of our stay). I did notice, however, that the AC was working and that our room, while not as big as in American hotels, was certainly big enough to move around. The bed sheets also seemed clean and the beds were so-so. The bathroom is maneuverable too, but I have to agree that the shower is very small (and I'm only 95 lbs). I had to open the shower door and soak the floor so I could shave my legs. We had free breakfast included, which was fruit, meats, bread and pastries. My only complaint about it was the very warm milk they had out everyday. Oh yeah, while the front desk service was very helpful, my sister and I were not pleased that every time we put the "Do Not Disturb/Do Not Clean the Room" sign, we would come back to our hotel with the sign off of the door, our sheets cleaned, beds made. While this wouldn't bother some people, it really bothered us because we hadn't locked some things away and were concerned with our privacy. What is the point of even having the sign if they're just going to ignore it??? The hotel served its purpose, but as a person who has stayed in many hotels around the world, this is definitely not at the top of my list. The front desk service was good, but it can't make up for the flies, the smell that hits you every time you open your door, the lack of privacy, and the neighborhood. My sister and I have decided that when we next come to Paris, we are going to stay closer to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cornelp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. It is located at 2 minutes walking from the metro station Gare de l'est, on a street one can hardly find without the help of someone who really knows the neighbourhood. The staff welcomed us warmly and gave us all the informations we asked. The room was small as every room / street / table at the restaurant seems to be in Paris. The room was phonically insulated and the temperature was ok. The bathroom was of course small but comfortable. The breakfast was included cheese (Camembert, Emmentaler, spread), cold meats, cereals, boiled eggs, only one sort of fruit (melon), jam, croissants, several types of bread, milk, yoghurt, tea, juice, coffee, etc. We expected a larger array of types of cheese and fruits. Overall though the bed was big and comfortable, the fact that the room, the hallway and the breakfast room were so small is not an advantage for anybody. Our room had no view (the view was on the interior yard). The street on which the hotel is located was quiet though it is close to the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms and definitely worth another stay”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtrav3l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stone's throw away from the Gare de l'est train station, which connects to a lot of metro lines and we were able to visit all the attractions by just taking the subway. The rooms are small but clean and we were lucky to have the A/C working and we couldn't hear anything from outside so we always had a good night sleep. The lighting could have been better because I had a hard time putting on my make up every morning since they use dimmed/yellow lights and even if I open the curtains, I still don't get enough lighting. The bathroom is small but manageable and the only thing I didn't like about it is that the tub is quite high and I had a hard time getting out of the tub without slipping. For a small bathroom, they should just use a regular shower instead of a shower/tub. Me and my husband were pleased with the breakfast since it starts early from 6:30 - 10 am and since we took some early trips to the champagne region, we were able to eat breakfast at 6:30 since we have to leave the hotel by 7am. The only downside, which I didn't really like is that everytime you go out, you have to give your room keycard to the receptionist and you can take it when you get back but they don't ask for your last name or a security question. I'm just concerned that anybody can just walk in and give a room no. and what if coincidentally they had the room no. right? Also, we always leave the "do not disturb" sign out the door, which has translations in french and other languages but somehow, housekeeping would always go in and clean the room for us. It is a nice gesture but other hotels are strict about their clients wishes and if they see the "do not disturb" sign, they just leave fresh towels, toilet paper, soap, etc. in a bag outside the door. Since the "do not disturb" sign doesn't work for us and since we have to give our room keycard everytime we go out, we make sure our luggages are always locked just in case. Overall, the hotel is nice and clean, location is good, well worth the money and the staff are very friendly, will definitely go back ;-)

Reviews.Title: “best stay of our 3 week Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: sposka
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. One of the best places we stayed in over the course of a 3 week Europe trip! The rooms are small but very clean and inviting. We stayed in a room that didnt have much noise from adjacent rooms or outside activity. Great continental breakfast too. Staff were all fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I were very pleased with our stay at Villa Saint Martin.”
Reviews.Author: Texastravellers2010
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient because its only about a block away from a metro station. Our room and bathroom were small but very nice and clean. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Before we arrived I had read some unhappy reviews regarding the air conditioning being broken; but I am happy to report the air conditioning was working just fine while we were there. We had breakfast there every morning; it was a nice variety of meats, cheeses, breads, fruits, etc...very yummy and very nice to have it provided for us before taking off for a full day of sightseeing. All in all our stay was a wonderful experience but in our opinion it was the staff that made it wonderful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but try to avoid room 339”
Reviews.Author: lesley2805
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our trip to Paris. After reading all the reviews for this hotel I was really pleased to secure a booking. It was fairly easy to find, we chose to walk from Gare du Nord and it only took 10 mins, Gare de L'est is about 3 mins so very handy for public transport .We got a really good deal with breakfast included, so we were really pleased with that. The hotel is spotless, not a bit of dirt anywhere. But after taking our luggage up to our room I was so disappointed. The room was so dark and dingy you had to have the light on day and night. The view from our window was the window into another room or a wall about 8 foot high, and we were on the 3rd floor. but as my husband pointed out we were only going to sleep in it. Easy for him to say but he didn't have to have the light on to put make-up on.If we wanted to see what the weather was like we had to go downstairs and look out side What made it worse was a day later I passed one of the front facing rooms that were being made up and it was so light and airy I could have cried. It looked so lovely. The good point about our room was the bed it was so comfy, I wish I could have brought it home with me. All the staff are so kind and helpful, they really go out of their way to help. Especially the four girls on the front desk. So on the plus side, the beds are lovely, the staff are wonderful, the hotel is spotless, the public transport is great. The minus side is room 339 is awful, there are no coffee/tea facilities in the rooms, the breakfast room is too small for the number of guests. On the strength of room 339 I dont think we will go back, but for someone who doesn't mind a dark room the hotel is perfect. So I'm very sorry, but it will be back to the drawing board for next years trip.Which is a shame because everyone is so nice.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zebrasky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa Saint Martin at the end of July. From the start I was made to feel very welcome. All the staff that I encountered spoke English. The staff were very helpful with all my questions. The room was rather large as far as Paris Hotel rooms go. It was very clean and the AC was working very well. The bathroom was also a good size and clean. The breakfast was OK. It was a good start the the day. The Metro stop, Gare de I' Est is right around the corner. There are numerous cafe's and shop, all within walking distance. I would stay here again without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT THINGS COME IN SMALL PACKAGES”
Reviews.Author: Charles0729
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Paris (for her dream vacation) and thanks to the staff at the Villa Saint Martin all of her dreams came true. Although the rooms are not as big as they are in the states, that doesn't matter considering the amount of time that was spent there. The service from the staff (Mauriel and Veronique) in particular was more then we could ask for. The hotel stay included a daily breakfast which was just enough to get our day going. The hotel is located less then 5 minutes walk to the Metro station that will zip you all over Paris in no time at all. This small hotel has BIG SERVICE and an even BIGGER HEART. We will return to Paris and will be staying at our new home away from home. Thank you Charles and Monique Room 449

Reviews.Title: “Excellent *** choice”
Reviews.Author: fujimiya_aya
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend spent two nights here and we were very satisfied with everything. Location: 5-minute walk from Gard du Est and the nearest underground stationg, 10-minute walk from Gard du Nord, you can reach the main attractions of the city in half an hour. Quite surroundings. Nice brasseries around. General facilities: Air condition, elevator, TV, safe... everything worked properly. Rooms: Very small, but nice and clean with attractive furniture, modern bathroom, towels and shower gel+body lotion changed and refilled every day. Service: Everybody we talked to spoke English. They were very helpful with everything. Breakfast: A basic but quality selection of buffet breakfast served in a pleasant breakfast bar. Everything is refilled regularly, you don't have to worry about being late for your fresh morning croissant. Overall impression: One of our best *** choice in our life. Warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in the summer”
Reviews.Author: shopping_girl_travel
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris on business with a colleague and chose to stay here based on the good reviews on trip advisor. The hotel advertised air conditioning but it did not work, the unit blew out hot air, there was no air conditioning. I asked the front desk about the AC several times and was told it was repaired, when it was not. It was very hard to sleep because of the heat, but if you opened the window the noise of the street was just as bad. The entire hotel was incredibly uncomfortable due to the heat, including the breakfast area. Several times I was provided with small hand towels to dry myself with after a shower. The room was so small I was only able to partially open the closet door and the door to the safe, my suitcase took up any space to walk. I ended up checking out several days early and moved to another hotel. Overall, I did not have a good stay at this hotel and would not recommend staying here in the heat of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here in summer again.”
Reviews.Author: Quilterliz
Reviews.Content: We are 3 adults, a female and two males. Stayed here for 7 nights and found the reception staff to be friendly and they spoke English which was good and they were very helpful etc. Room was very small with 3 single beds, bathroon tiny as well, Hotel is in a great location for the Metro, Worst thing was the rooms were very hot and when we asked about the airconditioning we were told it was being fixed, which never seemed to happen. It became very hard to sleep because of the heat, if you opened the window the noise of the street was just as bad. The hotel ran out of towels and we were given small hand towels to dry ourselves with, a bit hard with two males both about 6'5". Breakfast was good and that was a bonus. My son happened to stretch up and found the ceiling was like rubber, maybe that didn't help with the heat ! We were glad when our stay was up as the heat in the room was terrible. Thank you to the reception staff who were very friendly and even the cleaners were friendly. Would not recommend staying here in the heat of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, convenient price”
Reviews.Author: Brissie-Student
Reviews.Content: When you are in Paris, you shouldn't want to stay in your hotel room. So all you need is a clean little place in a convenient location (ie near a metro stop, and walking distance from Gare du Nord) to sleep, shower, and rest your tired feet. Villa Saint Martin offers all of these things at a great price. Where else can you find a hotel in a safe location for 100 euro/night?

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Laurem29
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights for my mother and I June 28 & 29. It was a great spot, stones throw to Gare de l'Est (train station). Learning the metro is so very simple and it's the cheapest way to get around Paris. Our room was nice, windows that opened onto the street to let in the breeze. We didn't find air conditioning in our room so expect to be very warm! Still the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was fine, no complaints! The staff does speak English very well and were very helpful. The breakfast was good. Nice assortment of pastries and other continental breakfast items. We were only there for 2 nights so we didn't get bored with it. We actually found it very enjoyable to simly walk downstairs rather than find a spot outside the hotel. I would definitely recommend a stay here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good price,very nice & friendly staff,near park & canal Saint Martin,clean rooms,good breakfast,we enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Caralumba
Reviews.Content: Quiet location, 200 m to Gare de l'Est, 100 m to metro station, nice park across the street, 150 m to canal Saint Martin, 20 min.walk to Louvre. Nice,clean room,large enough for two(for what i've heard about Paris hotel rooms). A nice surprise was the breakfast (continental),a short version of a swedish buffet. Very nice staff, friendly and helpfull.I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, close to transport, nice find!”
Reviews.Author: seemorun
Reviews.Content: I booked this after reading reviews on this site and I found them to be quite accurate. It's a cute hotel with very friendly and helpful front desk people who speak English. Your windows open to the outside and you get a lovely view of Gare d'Lest (sp?), which is also quite handy for travel. We took a circuitous route to get there and found some unsavory streets along the way, but you'll find that in any big city. Walk out of the hotel to the right and there's the canal with shops and restaurants and you get a feel for the city. I would stay here again. One caveat: if you're bigger than me, which is most people as I'm 5'7 and 160, you're going to have trouble showering. It's tiny, like phone booth small. If you drop something you have to get out to get it. For the price, location, amenities, I thought it was fair and I was pleased with our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcdefghijkl
Reviews.Content: Pros- Clean and comfortable rooms. Comfortable bed ( a very important factor) Friendly staff Good location right next to the a major station Free wifi Cons- Very small rooms Small breakfast room Nothing exceptional about the experience Breakfast can get repetitive, especially when you are staying for more than a few days

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk from Gare d'Nord and Gare de l'est”
Reviews.Author: Adventurebuzz
Reviews.Content: Had one night in Paris. Arrived mid-day on Eurostar Gare d'Nord. Walked maybe ten pleasant minutes to Villa St. Martin. Very nice three-star hotel -friendly staff, nice room, close to metro for zipping around the city. Next morning easy walk back to Gare d"Nord and a 45 minute RER to CDG. Very uncomplicated and better than hanging at a CDG airport for the night.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottsukMichel
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at the Villa St. Martin and I can honestly say it will not be my last. It is such a friendly hotel. The staff are always polite and all seem happy to help you. Even when staggering back at 2.30 in the morning you are greeted with a friendly smile. The rooms are always impeccably clean.(a word of thanks to the troupe of cleaners). The breakfast is amazing. So much to eat. Not your croissant and jam here. Lots of cooked meat , cheeses , cereals , bread. croissants , eggs, fresh fruit salad , fruit juices and copious amounts of hot tea , coffee and chocolate. Location is spot on. Metro Gare de L'Est line 4 gets you to Les Halle of Chatelet in no time and buy a Mobilis day ticket 5 euros 80. good value in what is an expensive city. Whilst at the Villa St Martin turn right out of the entrance and check out the Canal St Martin. A hidden part of Paris well worth exploring. All in all this hotel is a perfect place to stay. I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic find.”
Reviews.Author: treesofgold
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights for my teenage son and I after extensive reading of tripadvisor. We found it to be even better than expected. It is closer to Gare de l'Est than I had thought -- we could see the station front clearly from our hotel room window. This meant that we had lots of facilities on the doorstep -- pharmacy, baker's etc. at all hours, plus of course the metro station. There was a good chinese buffet cafe-bar near the station that seemed a magnet for locals (12 euros a head for evening meal). Our room was nice, lots of windows with wrought-iron balcony-effect railings, spotless white sheets and duvets, pin-operated safe. The bathroom was fine -- small shower cubicle but no smaller than I've seen in some houses in the UK, good shower with lots of hot water. Very modern-looking washbasin -- the kind where the marble/stone basin sits on a wooden stand; colourful tissues; big fluffy towels replaced every day; yves rocher shower gel and body lotion also replaced every day. Very friendly and helpful staff kept everyone's luggage for them on the last day. The evening receptionist went out of his way to get me some ice for my hayfever eyes. I bumped into a housekeeping lady and asked for an extra pillow and she delivered one to me not long after. Breakfast had everything we might want, including fruit salad, yoghurt and herbal teas. The bar was open in the evening and the reasonable prices were clearly displayed in the hotel room -- quite reassuring considering I had paid 4.50 euros for a tiny 25cl Evian in one bar in the city.... This hotel was a nice place to come back to at the end of a busy day walking round the city (although my son would have liked more TV channels). I would definitely stay here next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in France”
Reviews.Author: InSanDiego
Reviews.Content: After months of research and planning, we (my wife, son and his new wife) decided to stay at the the Villa Saint Martin on the Paris leg of our trips across Europe. It was the best decision we made our entire trip. We stayed 4 nights at the hotel. What a hidden secret!. First off, ALL of the staff speak English. That helped us so much. A young man by the name of "Willie" greeted us and throughout our stay, helped us so much with directions and suggestions on here to eat and better yet.... where NOT to eat. The last thing you want on a trip abroad is stomach problems. The next best gem about this hotel is the location. If you are coming by train, it is only a block away from the Est. Train Station. The underground Metro is also only a block away. My wife and I got a room on the 5th floor facing the street and my son and his wife had a room on the 4th floor, facing the courtyard. We had no complaints. It was exactly what we wanted. Two huge windows that opened up above the streets of Paris. The sounds and sights were just what we wanted. The room was cleaned daily along with fresh linen. There is a very small cafe off to the side of the front desk. There they provide a continental breakfast for 10 Euro a person. I would suggest eating there each morning because at 10 Euro you aren't going to get a better price on the street for all the different selections available. The only suggestion I would say is to get there early because seating is tight and once it fills up, it's kind of an problem moving around and accessing the food and drink. After hours you can always get a Coke or hot tea from this location. The bar is open in the evening, but who stays in their hotel room in Paris in the evening? Your in Paris, get out, see the sights and hear the sounds of this historic city. The elevator is a classic European one. Folks it's small... get use to it and move on. Two people and maybe some luggage will fit but it eventually gets you to your floor. My son loved his room. They kept the window open all night and never heard a sound. Now the street side of the hotel is a different story. Don't expect the city to shut down at 10PM because you are going to sleep. If you keep your windows open you will be awaken by school children across the street in the morning. There are three hospitals in the area and the French emergency vehicle drivers love to travel with their sirens on, coming and going. So you will hear the High, Low, High, Low sirens passing on nearby streets. If this bothers you, the windows shut out 98% of the noise out once they are closed. We would recommended this hotel to everyone. It's not a Holiday Inn. It is a traditional French hotel designed to European standards, not American. So everything is small but everything was very comfortable and CLEAN... Very Clean. Our check out bill was exactly the amount we agreed to on the Internet sight and not a penny more.

Reviews.Title: “A LIITLE GEM”
Reviews.Author: DMAXNorthEastEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Excellent locationn, 2 minutes walk from Gare de Lest. Very comfortable. The staff were very helpful, nothing being too much trouble.Small bar to relax in after a hard days sight seeing. Excellent breakfast. Would we go again?, most certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Saint Martin, Paris”
Reviews.Author: MartijnG3
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near the train station Gare De L'Est which is one of the biggest stations in Paris, so the location could not have been better. Rooms are smail but for a hotel in Paris there is nothing to complain. Staff is friendly and the breakfast buffet is oke.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location - Paris at your feet.”
Reviews.Author: Kentish_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easily reachable by metro from CDG Airport to the north. Don't get the bus, if you don't have to. It's a long journey and very difficult to find the right spot to stand and wait at the airport. The hotel itself is perfectly located near to Gare du L'Est train & metro station. The metro is very extensive and wide-ranging meaning you can reach almost anywhere in Paris within 30 mins (give or take a few change-overs). The staff were very friendly throughout our stay and the room was very clean. We stayed in a "superior double" and were very happy with it. We had a huge double bed and a large flatscreen tv on the wall for downtime, although the only english channel was CNN. The room had thick double glazed windows which excluded almost all noise - we slept very well indeed. Would definitely recommend for excellent location, cleanliness and price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, comfy bed, conveinent location”
Reviews.Author: gypsynewjersy
Reviews.Content: I had found this 3 star hotel through Gate One Travel. It is an excellent value. The breakfast was plentiful, the staff accommodating, and the location convenient to the metro. The rooms were clean with an extremely comfortable bed and cozy duvet. For me the best feature of this hotel was the staff. They are friendly and cannot do enough for you to make sure that you have a pleasant trip. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Dissapointed with Trip Advisor Reviews of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodsniffer
Reviews.Content: We booked Villa St. Martin hotel on a recent 4 day vacation to Paris. I will say that the other reviews of this hotel are just about right on and we were not dissapointed. Took RER train from DeGal, (sic?), airport to Gare du Nord train station and then walked to hotel with our luggage, (about 1/2 mile), without any problem. We compared the neighborhood that the hotel is located in to Greenwich Village, NY and it is safe, close to metro stop, and the scenic canal, with plenty of interesting shops, walking, etc. in the area. Hotel itself is clean with small but adequate rooms- typical Eurpopean. Great staff, and a very good breakfast each morning is included in room rate, (at least ours). To get to anywhere in Paris, just walk 2 blocks north to the Gare du Est train station and hop on the Metro.Highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for modestly priced stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean But Small Room”
Reviews.Author: smudge17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Friday 5 March 2010. We were here for our 10th wedding anniversary, i booked the flight and room together with directline holidays and got a very good deal. The hotel is very nice and is well decorated, the room is very small with just enough room for the bed. The bathroom was small but recently decorated and the shower was good, the staff were all helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel and this was fresh and very good not like you get in some hotels in the uk. We would have no problem staying here again if we ever visited paris again. The actually room rate was 146 euro per night. Marc Bradley

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbear0123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was resonable priced and in a good location to the metro to see all the sights. Andrea and Willy the front desk staff was very helpful and informative. The rooms was spacious and clean. We will definetly stay here again while visting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our stay in Paris even greater and more enjoyable...”
Reviews.Author: sisisico
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in. I stayed there for five nights in Feb 2010. Everything about it is great... location, cleanliness, service, breakfast, etc. The first room we were allocated had a standard bed which was pretty small. However, I had only to report my unsatisfaction about it to the reception that I was allocated another room with a bigger bed. Overall, a great place to stay in while enjoying the city of lights. The only things we complained about were the no tea/coffee making tools in the rooms and the TV channels which were all in French (except CNN). The breakfast was amazing. In fact, it was much better than the one I usually have at home. It consisted of French bread, butter croissant, chocolate croissant, apricot jam, cherry jam, cheese, French brie, eggs, corn flakes, and cold and hot drinks. We enjoyed it. This is all I can say about this place... enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCeres
Reviews.Content: My family tries to travel every year; we watch our budget carefully when we do. This was our first trip to Paris and we were not expecting a lot from the hotel since the rates were pretty low. Villa Saint Martin surprisingly exceeded our expectations -- it is a small hotel with small rooms (typical Paris), but the room and the bathroom were adequate and clean, breakfast was plentiful, walking distance to Gare de l'Est, Canal St Martin and restaurants along the canal, and the staff were amazing and exceptionally helpful especially Caroline. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: slbklyn
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Villa St. Martin with my husband, on a much-needed vacation. It was very easy to find, located very close to the Gare de l'Est train station, which was great for two jet-lagged individuals. We came in from Orly and took public transit all the way there, as well as to CDG on the way home. While close to public transit and walking distance to a ton of stuff, the neighborhood was pretty quiet and safe. It is blocks from the Canal St. Martin. Our room, which was on the 4th floor and faced the street, was small but totally adequate. I wasn't expecting anything fancy, just a clean place to sleep. When we checked in I asked the woman at the front desk if we could switch from a twin room to one with a double bed, and she recommended that we keep the twin because the room was bigger. I thought that was nice, and we managed just fine by pushing the two little beds together. We had plenty of space for the two of us, and we weren't there to hang out in a hotel room anyway! The room also had a safe, which was helpful. The bathroom was clean and super tiny. We had the smallest shower I had ever seen, and, being tall Americans, it was a bit of an adjustment. But honestly it was fine - as I said, cleanliness was paramount. The staff were all very nice and accommodating. Every interaction we had, with anyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff, was pleasant. We made an effort to speak French (we both speak enough to get by) but they always took pity on us an spoke to us in English. Breakfast (served every morning from 6:30-10) was great. There was a good selection of stuff: ham, cheese, cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea... It was nice to know that at least one meal of the day would be taken care of without having to think too hard! The only real issue I had with the hotel (and it was minor) was that we were dealing with major jet lag the first few days and wanted/needed to sleep a bit in the morning, but the housekeeping staff were overzealous and kept knocking, even if the "do not disturb" sign was on the door. I appreciate that they wanted to make up the room every day, but isn't that what the sign is for? To indicate that you don't want to be disturbed? But overall, I would recommend this place wholeheartedly for anyone visiting Paris on a budget. I loved how convenient it was to so many things, and it was a clean, quiet, friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Lisac2333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2010 and were extremely please with the accomodations. The rooms were clean and well kept and the staff was WONDERFUL. They were so willing to help, expecially because we spoke little french. It was a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone traveling through Paris. It is close to the major train station which is nice as well. It is a little far from some of the major attractions like Eiffel Tower and such, but it is close to Notre Dame and the Marais district (We were able to walk to Notre Dame in January). Great Hotel, Great Price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience here---Again”
Reviews.Author: bobby_d-1
Reviews.Content: Family owned property staffed by some family members. Extremely helpful. Good English. Convenient to the Metro, Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est. Boutique shopping and restaurants to the east toward the canal. Be careful to the west--Ave. Magenta. Lap tops available on request.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: knoffeltock
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Next to Gar de l´est. Clean. Nice Rooms. Fruit salad for Breakfast...mjam. Friendly staff. We felt very comfortable. The only negative aspect was a big spotlight outside which lit though our window during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: deXavier
Reviews.Content: This hotel was too expensive for what it is - which should be a cheap place to stay near Gare du Nord. It's in a fairly dodgy area - as I am sure I should have anticipated, being so close to both north Paris stations. Staff were perfectly pleasant and looked after my bag whilst I went off to explore Paris. But there is no where very good to eat near by and as I say, it's not somewhere where you want to be walking back to after dark on your own. Room was clean but tiny. On reflection I would have been much better off being further out, for less money, and getting the metro in to town.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yeah, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: flip52483
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. This was the second of the seven hotels that we stayed in when we visited France and this was was the best as far as location, size of room, and cost (in Paris). The neighborhood is good, the metro/train station is very close by and a short ride to Paris center. We stayed here for two nights out of the nine that we spent in Paris. The last six nights were at Paris 18 after four nights of seeing the Loire Valley. We highly regretted staying there after staying here the first few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aris_UK
Reviews.Content: Have arrived to that lovely hotel in Paris, been greeting by friendly staff. Nice and clean rooms. Lovely breakfast, plenty of food. Excellent service. Very local to the international train station, also close to central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: TartTart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than I expected. It is clean and good value. 5 minutes walk to the subway station. The continental breakfast is great. But the hallway is very narrow and dark. The heat is either too hot or none, never come to the comfor zone.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: meg-diana
Reviews.Content: sept 16-21 2009 we stayed recently at the Villa St Martin and were very pleased. The hotel desk personnel were always helpful and kind, The rooms are small but basically all you need, we didnt spend much time in there except to sleep. The rooms are not appointed in any fancy elaborate manner but are all you need, the linens are changed daily, rooms were clean, and staff kind and helpful. The bathrooms are small and the showers are very small, so some individuals may find that difficult, call and ask if there are options regarding kinds and size of bathrooms and showers/tubs. The rooms are all air-conditions and controls are in each room( not the case in many hotels, some centrally controlled). The hotel has a lift and a large area to store luggage pre and post check-in. The hotel provides a very nice breakfast( not so in many hotels) and there is a small bar available. The hotel is one block from the Metro, Train station and cabs are available there. If you need a cab, you can walk over to the metro and save 5 Euro right then. There is a large pharmacy in the station, many small cafes across from the station and in easy walking distance. All in all, we wanted a hotel not on a major road, a safe hotel, close to transportation services, and a helpful staff --> we found it. we will stay here again. This is a fine value and if you are going to see Paris and not live a week in the hotel this is a good choice, a great choice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place & Worth very Cent of Money”
Reviews.Author: Sultan09
Reviews.Content: It was our greatest pleasure staying at this hotel. We discoverd this place via Trip advisor. You cannot ask for more. Extra clean, comfortable room, excellent hotel staff who are very pleasant to solve any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GLCM87
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, quiet and clean. Not in the best of areas, but we had no problems at all. Really handy for gare du nord and gare du est stations and easy to walk down the main parts of paris as well. The rooms are very small- tiny in fact but are clean and secure. It's not the most luxurious hotels but for the money its good value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice part of Paris and very small, but very clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: NickBrenton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Villa St Martin for our honeymoon in Paris for 5 nights. Now we didn't want to spend a lot on a hotel as we wanted more money to spend in Paris, our two finalists were a hotel near the Luxembourg Gardens and this one, we chose this one as it was a touch cheaper and from the website looked fantastic. Probably a good move now I think about it! I emailed the hotel before we went to confirm the reservation as it was our honeymoon and I didn't want to be chucked in a 2 star down the road as some people were! I received a lovely email saying it was confirmed and thanks for choosing them for our honeymoon, they were honoured. On the day of our wedding we travelled to Paris and our flight was delayed 2 hours, by the time we walked through a busy airport terminal and two metro stations we managed to get to the hotel at 10:30pm instead of 7:00pm of course not the hotels fault but we were exhausted. When we got there we were greeted by a charming woman and a lovely foyer, the hotel looked fantastic, and we were then congratulated on our wedding that day but received nothing? I know it's a little bad to shave points for not upgrading or something similar but we didn't receive a thing, no flowers, no champagne, no room upgrade, nothing! Everyone I know who stayed in a hotel on their Honeymoon has had something! The hotel was quite empty as well so a room upgrade would have been ideal! We shrugged this off and were sent up the lift to our room, after walking around the 3ft wide corridors for 15 mins sweating in the Parisian heat and lugging a 20kg suitcase around I went back down only to be told we were on the other side of the hotel on the top floor, there was no lift this time and we had to walk up stairs, we stayed optimistic and decided it was our honeymoon and we would forget that as it had been a long day. When we reached our room I couldn't believe how small it was, I live in a relatively small house but this room and bathroom was no bigger than our front room, there was about enough room for the furniture and one person comfortably approx 10x10ft. The Bathroom was even smaller and probably about 5ft by 5ft. I had to sit on the far front edge of the toilet seat as my legs hit a wall and the shower to the left and right of me, I also had to step in the shower sideways and squeeze in being 6'1" and 18st. My wife is 5'0" 8st but she didn't like the fact there was nowhere to store her shoes and dresses! We thought about asking to move but we didn't want to be rude and we were so tired from a wedding day and travelling, we'd also unpacked. I stretched up one morning out of bed and my hands hit the ceiling, it turned out to be a thick rubbery plastic membrane and not a white painted ceiling, it was like a massive trampoline on the ceiling!! One accidental slash and the whole ceiling would come down raining plaster and stones and spiders everywhere!! My guess is that it was a cheap way to cover the AC units but it was very tacky and dodgy, it didn't make the rooms’ very sound proof either! Our window view was a random apartment and part of the hotel as well as the hotel courtyard which consisted of a scabby stone path and dirt/weeds; there was also a fantastic display of old bathroom sinks on the floor that seemed to be doing nothing. The breakfast was fantastic and there was a selection of cheese and ham, boiled eggs, croissants, pain au chocolat, melon, yogurt, cereal, bread, coffee, OJ. My wife and I loved this; it fuelled us up nicely for an early start in Paris. There was also a big screen with the news in French but it let you know the weather for the day which was handy! Everyone in the hotel was friendly and smiled and was very helpful and our room was cleaned every single day with towels and sheets being replaced without us even asking, it really was an immaculately clean hotel, the cleanest I have stayed in. The area around Villa Saint Martin is a tad dirty and seedy. There is a lot of rubbish about and it's a predominately muslim/african neighbourhood. There were a lot of homeless people sleeping on the streets and there was a surprising amount of dog mess on the pavements. There was also the odd prostitute hanging around (Probably a good point for some?). It was quite smelly as well (You know that holiday smell of sewage that drifts by your nose while walking?) In the day it was just run down Paris but at night it seemed a little rough. Towards the Canal was a lot better and there were various bars and bistros and a big Supermarche but again at night this was a tad rough. The area is right next to Pigalle the red light district of Paris so it's probably expected but when you've spent the day wandering the Latin Quarter or St Germain Des Pres you long for clean streets and other tourists. I know again it's not the hotels fault but this is a main aspect of choosing a hotel and I think location is a biggy! The Gard D L'Est is 3 mins walk and this is a main stop on the No 4 Metro line which is your main route into Paris' centre so getting into Paris was very easy. It was also relatively easy to get the RER to the airport from here so transport wise you’re in a good spot. I would say this hotel is perfect for those on a business trip as it's close to train station and airport and a quick trip to the centre. Or if your on a Stag Night/Hen Night in Paris it's ideal as there are bars and restaurants and the red light district, it's a 30 min walk to Paris nightlife as well I believe. It’s definitely not for a honeymoon couple and it's not for the retired couple looking to see Paris. If you like spending time in your hotel room with your Wi-Fi and 10million channels id say no as well. Clean, cheap & cheerful but very small and not nicely situated. Def not #148 of nearly 2000 hotels in Paris. Sorry to write a long one but I feel its necessary, hope this helps. Feel free to email me with any questions on [--] I don't have any photos of the hotel unfortunately, I only do that when i'm in a stunner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris Hotel and highly recommend it for the average traveller”
Reviews.Author: Sandgroperwun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I come from Western Australia and after four weeks in Russia, Finland, Estonia and London spent six enjoyable nights at Villa Saint Martin Hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. All spoke excellent English and helped us learn some basic French phrases for using elsewhere. Clean quiet hotel well located to Eurostar, metro, buses, canal, park, restaurants, small shops and the big Franprix supermarket. Great breakfast included. We had a superior room which was adequate in size and had a comfortable bed - we have experience standard rooms elsewhere and found them too small so no longer risk such rooms and pay a bit more for a larger room.
