The passageways were very narrow but accept that as "a Paris smaller hotel". No refrigerator in room was inconvenient. But overall we loved our stay at this hotel and would not hesitate recommending it. We also really appreciated the hotel arranging the transfer by excellent small limo type bus to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: moulins23
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel and for the first time I was so impressed I have decided to write a review. We booked this trip through Promo Vacances so the deal incuded breakfast. Unlike some previous reviews we thought the breakfast was excellent. Living in France we did not expect eggs and bacon but thought the typical continental fare was of a good quality with sufficient choice to please most people, the bread was particularly good. Having read the problems some peole have experienced with showers, I telephoned the hotel prior to our arrival to explain my husband is a large man and we consequently received a room with a large modern shower. The room was fairly small, typical of Paris, but the bed was huge and the room was clean and comfortable. We liked the location of the hotel and found the multi-cultural area to be interesting. There were plenty of restaurants nearby ranging from cheap and cheerful to "OMG"!! Just a few minutes walk there was also a "MonoP" selling a good range of sandwiches, salads and snacks, as well as normal groceries, open from 9am to midnight. There are a good selection of bars which are a great place to people watch. The metro station is about 100 metres from the hotel and the open tour bus stop is even nearer. We did this tour on a 2 day ticket and found it good value for money, but only if you do the 2 day tour as there is only 3 euro difference per person between 1 day and 2. All in all. if you are considering a trip to Paris, I cannot recommend this hotel too highly..

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: searcher008
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in most areas of Paris it was a joy to find this hotel after such a long time.As with most hotels in Paris the rooms are on the small side but Caroline the receptionist arranged for us to have a pleasant larger front facing room for a supplement.Caroline was most helpfull to us on our stay,the hotel is very close to the Metro and the Gare De L'Est and numerous bus routes.I hope to visit the companies new hotel situated near the Gare St Lazare later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located hotel - a parisian gem”
Reviews.Author: angep1969
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Airmiles, having looked at many reviews of many hotels in Paris. It is fair to say that Parisian Hotels are not renowned for their roominess and the Villa Saint Martin is no exception. I'd booked a double and it was tiny - even to the extent that the bathroom was so small it contained a shower only - no problem with this except that it was so squeezed in that my partner was unable to actually get into the cubicle. No matter though as, upon booking in, the incredibly helpful receptionist had pre-warned us that the room was very small and offered to swap us to a twin room the next day. This was duly sorted out whilst we were out sightseeing and the new twin room was a vast improvement. Much bigger and with a fancy shower you could fit two into!! The hotel is located within a stone's throw of Gare De L'Est and about a 15 minute walk from Gare Du Nord - so was ideal for us as we travelled in by Eurostar. The area is not the swankiest Paris has to offer but I felt safe and secure at all times and there was a good selection of bars/restaurants nearby. (Would recommend La Bulle as a place to eat - not cheap but the food was stunning - and just a short walk north up the canal). we had continental breakfast included which was plentiful and just what I would expect with the usual selection of cheese, ham, fruit, bread, croissants etc. Where the hotel scored highly with us though was with their staff - all spoke excellent English and couldn't have been more helpful. An absolute joy for Paris where, in the past, I have felt the locals can be a bit stand-offish. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel but would suggest you book a twin rather than a double as you will get a lot more room and comfort this way.

Reviews.Title: “nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: deuce1011
Reviews.Content: room was clean and comfortable, but small. very close to metro stop and gare de l'est (big train station). breakfast was very good, with lots of choices. nice hotel for the price, especially if you dont plan on spending a lot of time in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with convenient acces to metro and tourist bus”
Reviews.Author: mwilliams205
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny but we were told to expect that in Paris. Lift is very small and if you have luggage 2 people cant fit in. Hallways very small, even 2 thin people would have trouble passing each other. But that is Paris and we were amused by all that,not upset. Breakfast was typical french fare, lots of croissants, hams, fruit, yoghurt. Coffee was from an instant machine which we didnt like. Staff were very helpful and very nice. If you are arriving from London on eurostar, you can walk to the hotel. Its also close to the Gare de L'est (now famous because it featured heavily in the french movie AMELIE) and close to the tourist bus. Nice cafes in the area but be careful at night. By day the area is good but at night, we didnt wander around as it is not a touristy area and lots of shady characters hanging around. When you go out at night, order a taxi from your hotel. Coming from australia, the hotel was very expensive but that is Paris and we were very happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable base of operations. Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: vballmdbkr
Reviews.Content: Caroline at the front desk was super helpful and went out of her way to ensure we had a great stay. She emailed me before we left the States to make sure my needs were met. We are used to large open rooms and this was our first time in Paris so the size of the rooms we small for us. They were clean and comfortable with new bathroom amenities. The Breakfast that was included was Ok but it never changed and we would have liked a little variety. All in all it was a good place to stay and was only 1 block from the Metro (Master the Metro as it is the absolute best way to get around) Great Cafe's in the neighborhood (Piano Bar) made finding a good meal easy after running all over the City and returning to the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Small but Cozy”
Reviews.Author: BellaAthena
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were always helpful and greeted you everytime you walked past reception. Our room was TINY with a pretty view of the courtyard. It did it's purpose, it was warm and comfortable. It took a while to figure out how to use the shower! Breakfast was the standard European fare (same everyday). Try the croissants! The area was eccentric and certainly not touristy. But it's close to the Metro and Gare du Est (you can walk there), it was easy to the touristy bits of Paris. I would recommend exploring the area during the day, some cool little boutiquey odds and ends stores. At night, stick to main roads, it just felt a little unsafe. Wireless internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Eurostar arrivals, to far from Paris sights.”
Reviews.Author: misscappuccino
Reviews.Content: Good location if arriving from London on the Eurostar Train. Location to far from all the top 10 Paris sights. The metro is close to the hotel. Rooms are a bit small could use a renovation more updating. Breakfast was ok not many choices. Staff was friendly. We had friends staying in the Latin Quarter they were very close to the attractions. I would suggest staying in the Latin Quarter it is very quaint and close to the city center. The Villa St Martin is to far North in the city, just taxi down to Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value 3*** Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LifeWorkbalanced
Reviews.Content: Villa Saint Martin is a great value 3*** Hotel particularly for an expensive city like Paris. It is well located for metro/train and bus journeys from Gare de L'Est which is about 200 metres away. The Reception staff were most helpful and friendly at all times. We had a fairly large room at the back of the hotel with the adjacent school backing on to the picturesque Saint Martin canal. The room decor was fine apart from a prominant rainwater ? stain on the curtains. An unexpected bonus was the 42" flat screen LCD tv which had several decent English/US films during our stay. The bathroom had a half sized bath which was a bit cramped for 6ft plus but nevertheless much appreciated after pounding the streets for hours looking at the sights. The Breakfast room was fairly small and can get busy at times but is available from 0630 which is useful for early departures or excursions. The buffet style cold breakfast included a good range of hot drinks,fruit juice, cereal, fruit salad,breads,pastries, hams etc which were regularly topped up. We will definately stay there again and have no hesitation in recommending Villa Saint Martin to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BUCEPHALES
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an extremely pleasant stay for 4 nights at this hotel and heartily recommend to every one who is looking for a good hotel in expensive Paris. The staff were excellent, the breakfast was very good, the room(superior but well worth the little extra we paid) was clean, and the bathroom was well appointed although we would have preferred a bath as well as the shower. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Regarding the expense of Paris due to the pound exchange rate; it was still possible to search out reasonably priced restaurants for the evening meal. We found several off the main roads and at no time did we feel uncomfortable or threatened. The area around the hotel was a surprise as we did not realise the canal was so charming. It must be a great area inthe summer. Our trip to the Palace de Versailles (all pre booked on the net to avoid the queues ) was stunning. Our second 4 day trip to Paris and it di not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Gare de l'est and Gare du Nord”
Reviews.Author: Nasher78
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location for Gare de l'est (2 minute walk) and Gare du Nord (10 minute walk). Rooms are small but clean, with a nice bathroom (bath very small.. but at least it had a bath). Plenty of choice for breakfast, staff helpful and pleasant. Perfect for a weekend stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great find, loved the area, wonderful gem of a hotel in canal saint martin area”
Reviews.Author: pjs536rome
Reviews.Content: great rooms, great staff, free internet, free luggage storage, good location, fantastic breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and small.”
Reviews.Author: Bogacha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Villa Saint Martin for nearly a week. The location is decent with quick access to the Metro and several choices for dining within a short walking distance. The building across the street gave off the vibe of a mental asylum with constant congregations of some very strange people. Other then the occasional homeless person, the area is safe. The hotel is a little small though quite comfortable. The room itself was quite small and I normally wouldn't be bothered by the size, but I felt it mildly diffiicult to unwind. The decor was modern and the room was very clean. The washroom was immaculate, the bathtub in particular radiated with a spotless shine. There was a large screen flat TV that contained a few english channels, including CNN. The staff was flawless, very friendly and accomodating. I had just arrived from a trip in the Middle-East in which I was suffering from an violent, ongoing case of traveller's diarrhea. It reached the point where I required medical attention. The staff contacted a doctor and within hours, I received medical attention and picked up my antibiotics. Needless to say the French medical system is second to none. The entire staff was very courteous and quite sympathetic to my ordeal, especially considering the wretched smell exuding from our hotel room. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at Villa Saint Martin. I likely wo It certainly gets my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for its money!!!”
Reviews.Author: pipi1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Villa Saint Martin for 5 days....4 to say the truth, as there was a little problem with our booking and we had to spend a night in another hotel nearby ("All seasons"). This was a nice hotel, more expensive than Villa saint Martin (though not as good) but as the difference and the taxi were payed by them, we didn't have any problem to stay there for our first night in Paris. The day after, we returned to Villa saint Martin, to stay in a bigger room than that we booked, a "juniour suite" actually, without any extra charge! There was a comfortable double bed and a wide plasma TV!!! The bathroom was spacious enough and the room kept extremely clean every day!!! As for the breakfast, it was very rich (baquettes, croissants, milk, marmelade, ham, cheese, eggs....and many more)! The staff spoke english fluently, they were very friendly and cheerful! The hotel is located next to the metro station (Gare de l' Est), however the place is very safe! I would recommend you, staying in Villa Saint Martin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extermely convenient”
Reviews.Author: dreamer888
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Villa Saint Martin hotel, and all in all it was a very pleasent and enjoyable experience. The hotel itself is situated about a 20 minute walk from the Gare du Nord and only 2 minutes from the Gare de l'est, from which the metro leaves. We found this very convienent and with the metro being so cheap, much easier than a taxi. The hotel was quite small, with a tiny lift hardly holding more than 3 at a time and small corridors leading to the rooms. The rooms were small but perfect fro what we needed in Paris, a base. We did however find that the bathroom did seem to get damp quite easily, but with clean towels everyday this really didn't bother us. The main downside to the hotel was at night time the room was extremely hot and sticky. At points to hot to bare, and we needed to sleep with the windows open...even in the middle of winter! But that was a snag we were willing to accept as all in all we found the hotel to be excellent value for money! One word of advise would be that if the breakfast is not included, I wouldn't pay 10 euros for it as there are plenty of cafes only a minute away that would serve a hot alternative!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: awayuk
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here just before Christmas. It cost around 43 euro per night (via skoosh) for a double en suite room including a cold buffet breakfast which was very good. What a bargain! The staff were friendly, helpful and all spoke English. As gay travellers we weren't made to feel uncomfortable. The room was clean and perfectly adequate (and it was nice and warm - the heating worked and the windows opened). The hotel is close to Gare de l'est metro station (making it an easy trip by public transport to and from the airport: train to Gare du Nord one metro stop from there) and there are plenty of cafes around for eating locally. Paris is a large city and you need to get the metro everywhere so it's fair to say the hotel is pretty central - not out in the sticks anyway. It felt fairly safe around there at night. Can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Steve_in_Barnet
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9.30 PM at night to be told they had made a mistake on the dates and were full, but not to worry as they had booked us a room at another 3* more expensive hotel just a 7 minute walk away. We were given a well photocopied map of how to get to the other hotel (so I think this was not the first time). After walking for 25 minutes in the rain we found the other hotel, which was acceptable but more like a 2* hotel. In my opinion the hotel takes extra bookings but banks on a no-show or has a deal with the other hotel to pass on bookings it cannot meet. Complaining to the booking company seems like a waste of time as they state on their website: "The accommodation providers reserve the right to change your accommodation to an alternative"! Be careful. Alex, Barnet, North London.

Reviews.Title: “good, cheap, clean accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ascrawley
Reviews.Content: This is a very small but clean, friendly and well appointed hotel. It is situated 2 minutes walk away from gare de l'est and the St martin canal. The rooms are very very small as is the whole hotel, but the staff are friendly and it is reasonably priced. The breakfast is a little dull and lacks a warm alternative, but adequate. I would recommend this hotel to couples but families may find the rooms too small. All in all a good clean option for accommodation in paris.

Reviews.Title: “A bit sparse, but a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mrlayl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Villa St. Martin from Sept 26, 2008 to Oct. 4th, 2008. First the pluses: 1) Location - Although a 15 minute subway ride from the Louvre, its walking (3 minutes) distance to Gare De E'st train and subway station. 2) Breakfast - Ample supply of breakfast cheeses,meats, fruit, cereal, and coffee until 10 AM with plenty of seating at the breakfast room. 3) Staff- All spoke good English and were helpful, although some were at times defensive when an inadequacy was pointed out. 4) Free internet and loaner laptop. Now for the minuses: A) Rooms are small so additional cost to upgrade toa Jr. Suite was worth it. B) Furnishings, bed covers and room decor although clean look basic and dated. C) A couple of torn up bath towels upon check-in (replaced the next day) were disappointing. D) Had to push together 2 beds slightly wider than American twin size to create an uncomfortable full size bed. they claimed that was as large as a bed size they had in the hotel. E) Hotel overlooks and shares a wall with an elementary school yard. So, depending on the season, you may be awakened at 8 AM to the sound of school children playing in the yard. Although, if the window is closed double pane windows block most of the noise. If you decide to walk to the city center try to avoid the Republic neighborhood, by asking the front desk people for routes that do not cross the area. Monmart is close - about 30 minutes walk and Canal St. Martin area is an up and coming mostly residential neighborhood. All and all, depending on the price you pay, this could be a good place to stay in Paris without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: laz81
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Villa Saint Martin 3 nights and had a great experience. Staff were very polite and friendly, all speaking english. When we arrived late in the evening, the receptionist greeted us by our name and saying "we've been expecting you". Great little detail. Room was good standard. Lcd tv on the wall, not like you will need it in Paris,just in case. Bathroom clean, shower could be a bit bigger but overall normal size, toilet paper was soft not like some places having boardpaper and even tissues. Breakfast was excellent, including ham, cheese, boiled eggs, pastries, eat as much as you can. Location is great 3 min to nearest metro (Gare De l'Est), from there you can reach main attractions in 10 min. Gare du Nord also 1 metro stop away, if you travelling from/to Charles De Gaulle Airport. Overall it was a great stay, especially for the price (we paid £160 for double room for 3 nights), would def recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katyaw41
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth visit to Paris in 3 years and each time I've stayed in a different place. Not for my 6th visit. For that one I will definitely be staying at Villa Saint Martin again!!! It's so convenient for the metro and overland trains, Gare du Nord & Gare de l'Est are literally 15 mins walk and 5 mins walk away. Normal buses are around the corner and the yellow line of the Green Tour Bus (Opéra/Sacré-Cœur/Montmatre) stops just across the road. Lots of restaurants around. Convenience store about 8 mins away and after another 15-20 mins walk (I walk slowly) there's an absolutely fabulous food market! So fresh! The hotel breakfast was brill and highly recommended. There are the obligatory homeless people and the odd strange person but all in all the location is very good and the hotel was clean and service was very good. It felt very safe, even in the early morning hours. Three complaints (because I have to). 1 - the bathroom did not have an apparent working vent and got pretty steamed up when in the shower and everywhere ended up dripping but nice shower. 2 - the walls are maybe too thin as we had one guest knocking on our door asking us to be quiet because they needed to sleep (pathetic woman, you're on holiday, let your hair down, we were only laughing!!!). 3 - only English telly was CNN. I highly recommend Villa Saint Martin for your stay in gay Paree!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: scottsiegel1959
Reviews.Content: Had to stay for 1 extra night and booked 2 singles via Kayak ($141), Clean, modern, flat screen tv (CNN). Location is great. A hop.skip and a jump from Gare D' la Est.. Booked two rooms and and to be next to each other. Wasn't possible so we stayed on 2 different floors. Without asking we got "larger" rooms. Mine was fine and my mom's was even larger.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: LoriQM
Reviews.Content: Hotel was modern and clean. Nice decor. Room was a fair size for Paris and had a large flat screen TV and digital safe included at no extra charge. Buffet breakfast was ok too. En-suite was a bit small especially the shower, but overall acceptable. Staff were helpful, nice and polite and room was cleaned every day if requested. Good base for sightseeing although didn't spend a lot of time there as no foyer to sit in, only the bar area which was fairly quiet. VERY close to the metro and Gare de l'est RER station so ideally sited and within 10-15 mins walking distance of centre of Paris / Louvre etc. Area ok at night, but has a few homeless people round about the station area. Didnt feel unsafe at any time though. Would recommend, good value. LM, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: starlit179
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel. It is a great place to stay - you are approx 15-20 minutes from most of the attractions in Paris. This location is approx 2 blocks from the Gare de l'Est station - which would take you less than 5 minutes. It is approx a 10 minute walk to Gare du Nord station. The service was fantastic and their breakfast was great. The room is small, but that is normal in Paris. It is a very clean & decent hotel. The neighborhood is decent & we never felt uneasy or unsafe - even in the early morning hours! If we get the opportunity to go back to Paris - we will look into staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locqtion”
Reviews.Author: NigelTaylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from 29 September to 4 October. The hotel is well sited for Gard de Nord station. I had a room on the third floor which was sufficient for one person. The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful. There was a good variety of food for breakfast. The bar was very quiet and gave you some space in the evening. Sweets at the reception were a nice touch. Wireless access to the internet was available and you could borrow their laptop if you did not have your own. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tntravel908
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel on a quiet side street. Rooms were very small. We barely had enough room to put our luggage. The hotel is a 2 min walk from the Est Metro station. You have to take the metro to get to any touristy areas. I did not feel completely safe in the area that the hotel was in at night. We walked around the area of the hotel one afternoon and quickly turned around as we did not feel safe. The hotel had a very nice breakfast buffet. The front desk staff let us use their laptop with wireless internet to check our email. I felt that this hotel is very reasonably priced for Paris. If you do not mind taking the Metro everywhere you need to go then this is a nice hotel. I would stay at Villa Saint Martin again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ffdoc2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights sept 2008, and would stay here again with no hesitation at all. For those of us with extremely limited (if any) French speaking skills it never mattered as the people at the front desk as well as the breakfast all spoke easily understood fluent English, which they used the moment i opened my mouth and they heard my fractured "bonjour". The room was smallish but then we didn't go to Paris to hang out in our room, and yes the shower was tight, that just made you get more creative about how to shower. Our room had no tub, which didn't matter to us but might to someone else. Particularly nice was the included breakfast. There were 3 or 4 types of pastries, a couple kinds of cereal, hard boiled eggs, 3 kinds of meat, 3 or more types of cheese, yogart, fresh fruit cut up, a couple kinds of juice, a few kinds of tea, and various coffees. Seating was plentiful, as were plates, silverware, etc. The area where it is located is not near many of the sites one is likely to want to see, however the Gare D'est metro station is roughly a 3 minute walk, there is a hop on/hop off bus stop even closer, and a few restaurants nearby, even a McDonalds, which was nice coming back to the hotel at night for a shake or coke if nothing else. We never felt uncomfortable in the neighborhood, our room was spotless, there is a safe in the room, hair dryer, flat screen TV, (only English channel though was CNN but again who goes to Paris to watch TV?) I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone except perhaps someone who for whatever reason is hesitant to take the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service !! loved this charmer.”
Reviews.Author: BookloverAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Saint Martin Paris for 3 nights - i picked this hotel based on the Tripadviser reviews and I am so glad I did !! The guest service was amazing from the very start - Adis, the Front Desk Manager spoke English (I am American) and he made our stay very special. Also, Emilia, at the front desk was wonderful - she gave us a restaurant recommendation on our first night in Paris and the food and the service there was amazing. Our room had two windows that opened up for fresh air and views of the city. Our bedding was comfortable and the shower water pressure was better than I have at home. The room was clean, and relaxing. We were convenient to the Metro for acces to the sights we wanted to see. They arranged for a shuttle to the airport, it was on time and very convenient. I loved my stay, it was our 10th anniversary. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Thanks to Adis and Emilia, and the rest of the staff - you're the best. Anita and Todd Voris - Phoenix, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Completely Overrated”
Reviews.Author: MNSpark
Reviews.Content: We booked the Villa St. Martin based upon tripadvisor reviews. That was a mistake. I would never stay here again. The hotel lacks charm, the staff is nice but unhelpful and the halls are like rabbit warrens. We booked a junior suite and it was smaller than delightful rooms we had previously stayed at on the left bank. There was one window that provided little light. Finally, we booked a shuttle to CDG through the hotel. The shuttle ran two hours late and we missed our flight. We had to spend the night at the airport. All and all - it was a grand disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ORreviewer
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult son, and I stayed at Villa St. Martin for 4 nights in early August (2008). We stayed in a Triple room which had 2 twin beds that could be pushed together and a roll-out double bed that stayed up during our stay. The room was large enough for 3 and all of our suitcases so we were not bumping into each other. There was a balcony and windows that open for fresh air. There was also air conditioning. The bathroom was "ensuite" and very adequate in size for three of us. Note though that the shower/tub combination had very high sides so some may have difficulty getting in and out of the tub. The hallways and elevator are small. However, the staff are helpful and speak English well. The breakfast was buffet style that provided 2 cereals, several juices, a meat platter, cheese, bread and pastries. Shampoos and hair dryer were provided. The location is not too far from a bus stop or underground station and there are restaurants near by. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A great little place...”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver21
Reviews.Content: The wife and I took a weekend off in Paris - it was her first time, and chose this hotel based on lots of good reviews. To start, the location is away from a lot of big city/touristy bustle. A very quite neighborhood at night. It's a 2 min walk to the Gare de l'Est train station. This is a main exchange and you can get to anywhere in Paris easily. The hotel itself is very cute and clean inside. The décor is modern and tasteful. They do not offer free breakfast, but it is available and quite good. A modest selection of fruit, bread, yogurt, juice and of course coffee. There are a few cafes close by if you want that option. Rooms are small - typical for this type of hotel. It was adequate though - we didn't spend any time in there anyway - after all, we were in Paris. Anyway the room had a flat screen to save space and a safe for your valuables. It had enough room for our packs and the bathroom was very clean a well appointed. One very notable item was the shower. It was an awesome full body shower with about 5 nozzles running the length of the wall. A fun shower to use.Overall the staff was great, no problems, they were all helpful and accommodating. This was a pleasant experience altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bluering73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Room, medium size, clean and tidy, bath room clean but cluttered and badly designed. Reception quite courteous and helpful. Breakfast excellent, a good variety of food but the room is cluttered with awkward chairs. Hotel location excellent, 2 min walk to Gare de l’Est, it was a bonus to catch the train to go to anywhere in Paris, and no money was wasted catching taxi. Unfortunately, the airconditioning was not working, luckily it was not hot during our stay in Paris. Overall experience quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected after reading earlier reviews”
Reviews.Author: calibj
Reviews.Content: Nice service by the staff, but let down by the quality of the rooms. Much smaller rooms than expected, even given that I've stayed in many Paris hotels. We changed rooms due to initially being allocated a room next to a building site with constant jack-hammering. Avoid room 163 as it was tiny, while our new room was a more reasonable size, so maybe best to check out the room first before unpacking. Hotel is in a reasonable area, next to Est train station, but it is a more residential area. Can walk to Montmartre without too much trouble, and the Republique/Grand Boulevard areas. A few interesting characters in the area as you'd expect near 2 of the main train stations (Est and Nord). Also the busy Canal Saint Martin is just down the end of the street, which is bustling during summer. Bathroom nice and clean although small; Bed fairly solid not too soft; Breakfast plentiful for typical French continental buffet style; the lobby bar is fairly quiet but they will happily fix u a drink; Rooms have good plasma TV (only CNN in english); no mini bar or fridge for chilling the champagne though :) Overall is a passable hotel without quite living up the the reputation of the reviews so far.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: SiteCer
Reviews.Content: The Villa Saint Martin is a lovely hotel. I booked it as a package deal (fly into/stay in London, train to Paris, stay in/fly out of Paris) and, as included in the package, it was very good bargain. As others have noted, it is very conveniently located near Gare de l'Est where there are a few Metro lines. The breakfast included was more than adequate and the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. They helped me arrange a shuttle to the airport for a very early departing flight. The fact that I do not speak French was not a problem at all. Although my reservation was for a single, I was very surprised to get to my room and find a double bed (rather than a twin). The room was on the small side but very clean and had everything I could need. I also appreciated having CNN Europe as one of the TV stations available since it is in English and I could catch up with what was going on in the world. The only minor issue is that the shower was extremely small (2.5' x 3' x 6.5'). Since I am petite, it wasn't that much of a problem for me but it could definitely be a problem for others. The shower also leaked so do not leave anything on the floor that you do not want wet. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travelers coming/going east or north of Paris”
Reviews.Author: BoarderX
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on the Villa St. Martin based on other reviews. The positives are dead-on. Small room, but very standard for Paris. Very clean and modern, and everything was in working order. Wireless Internet access in the room was nice and convenient, although not superfast. The breakfast included in the rate is somewhat limited but certainly more than coffee and a croissant. Given all this, the St. Martin is a unique value for its location, a block from Gare de l'Est and four blocks from Gare du Nord. So it is perfect if you're arriving late into Paris or leaving early, either from/to CDG airport or to point east or north (including the UK, Benelux, and Germany). Most of the other hotels close to these stations are either undesirable or overly pricey, but the St. Martin gets it just right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quaint hotel with lots of French character”
Reviews.Author: planefun1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Saint Martin while on a side trip to Paris for 4 days. We booked the hotel through otel dot com. This site provided the best rate, included taxes and fees and a great continental French breakfast. French breakfast includes varieties of pastries, cheeses and meats along with fruits, cereals and coffee and juice. With the value, or lack of of the value of the dollar in Europe, this is a substantial savings, since a cafe breakfast will cost 6-10 Euros which is $12-20 US. This hotel is quaint. It's walking distance (2 blocks) from the Gare de lst metro stop. All the sites are no more than a 10-20 minute metro ride. This is a safe, no frills neighborhood with a few restaurants, wine/grocery stop . Hotel is very convenient , clean and has a nice front desk staff that speaks English. Rooms were remodeled recently and exudes typical French charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Barbwire184
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for the Villa St Martin. It is located in a very quiet area of Paris yet five minutes and your in the middle of everything. The whole hotel is very well kept meaning very clean,very professional staff,nothing but praise. I went to Paris by myself and was a little hesitant about seeing everything I wanted to see and do but ,the staff went above and beyond to make sure I got everything I needed to see and do all. All spoke fluent English which was a big relief for me. Staff made calls for, found addresses everything I ask for they helped with. I'm going back to Paris in August and already know where I'll be staying. I have nothing but praise for Villa St Martin Hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: California26
Reviews.Content: Very well-maintained, clean facility. Location is two short blocks south of Gare d'est, the gateway for high-speed trains to eastern France, and about 5 blocks south of Gare d'nord, a stop on the train from Paris/CDG airport. Metro/subway stop at Gare d'est. Airport limo service back to the airport, arranged by the front desk, was reasonable and easier than dragging luggage back to the train station. Rooms are very clean and well-maintained with modern, up-to-date bathrooms and plasma cable TV. Reception is very friendly, helpful, and fluent in English. A big attraction is the free internet throughout the hotel, including all rooms -- both broadband (bring your own network cable) and wifi. The neighborhood is not one of the chicest, but with the convenience to trains and subways, it's quite acceptable, and I felt safe walking around in all directions. Given the very weak dollar, and otherwise exhorbitant prices in Paris, this is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: ChristineLim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Saint Martin for 3 nights during our stay in Paris and we totally enjoy it. The location of the hotel is very near to the Gare de l'est metro station, which made it really easy for us to explore Paris without having to spend too much time on travelling. One thing that I absolutely must mention is the excellent service that we'd received. Everyone in the hotel was extremely friendly and the front desk personals speak excellent english. I had fun chit-chatting with the lady at the front desk (sorry I couldn't remember the name) who had been to Singapore. The room was clean, comfortable and safe to leave our stuff in. The size of the room may not be big but that's common in Europe. Best of all, we had free wireless internet connection through our stay. How nice! Overall, Villa St Martin is value for money and I'm sure the staffs at the hotel will deliver excellent service. I will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for First-Time Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Self_Portrait
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in February 2008 (celebrating our 35th anniversary) and can describe the Villa as absolutely delightful. This was our first trip out of the United States to Europe, Paris being a 10 year dream-come-true, vacation. The room was small by American standards, but had better amenities and was laid out better than some 4-star resorts we've stayed at in the States. It was very clean!! The hotel is just a few minutes walking to the Metro and train station. The staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful. We arrived 5 hours before check-in and they allowed us to leave our luggage, while we began exploring Paris. We were a little nervous about our shuttle to the airport on the return trip, but the front desk assured us everything was all right, and it was. The breakfast was a real meal...coffee, pastries, cheeses, juice,etc,etc,etc...a great start for the day. We stayed on one of the top floors with two windows overlooking the city. It was just a joy to look out the windows and soak up this magical city. Thank you Villa Saint Martin for adding to the Magic of Paris. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GGirlLimerick
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel. I visited Paris last november and really enjoyed my stay. The staff are so polite and very helpful. They organised a trip for us to go to DisneyLand and got our travel to the bus station. It is in a lovely location near the train station. there is also a few lovely restaurants around.All staff have very good english. The accomodation is lovely and as its small there is virtually no noise. Would recommend it to everyone wanting to visit paris and will without a doubt return!.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice to feel Paris”
Reviews.Author: tbalazs
Reviews.Content: We have spent our honeymoon in Paris, in the Hotel Villa St. Martin. We had 8 days there, and it was all beautiful. The location of the hotel is fantastic; near the subway, and all thing you need is very close to the hotel. There are restaurants, cafes, bakery, rent-a-bicycle and a railway station. The nearby St. Martin Canal is a very nice part of the city, at the afternoon a lot of people meets there with a bottle of vine, with a bagette and a guitar to have a picnic. The hotel staff is excellent, they speak very good in english [better than me], very helpful and they have a laptop at the reception desk, which you can use in the bar whenever you want . There are Wifi in the hotel. The rooms are small but comfortable with air conditioning. Only one thing was negative for me, the totally lack of sound proof of the walls. Our honeymoon was OK, but our neighbours? At all, it's a very good and not too expensive hotel with a fantastic location. tbalazs

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: sdyson
Reviews.Content: Villa Saint-Martin is well situated if you are arriving in Paris via the Eurostar. It is a short walk or, if you have heavy bags, a single stop on the metro. All central Paris attractions are within at most a 20 minute Metro journey. We stayed in room 229 and were told that this was the largest room in the hotel. The room was spacious with a large Samsung LCD TV mounted on the wall. The staff were all friendly and spoke excellent English. The breakfast buffet had a wide selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: KVATX
Reviews.Content: We've recently returned from staying at the Villa Saint Martin for 3 nights while on vacation. The staff was very helpful. They gave us directions and were always very pleasant when we came back to the hotel in the evening. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. The bath was a little small and difficult to take a shower in, so request a room with a shower only if that is your preference. The metro was very close and had three lines to choose from which made it very easy to zip around town.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend In Paris”
Reviews.Author: juicyjackie
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights at the Villa Saint Martin. 24/4/08-27/4/08. Pleasant stay. Breakfast as previously described, was plentiful and tasty. The room was *very* small - approx 9x10 feet , but nevertheless, clean and fit for purpose. The small ensuite was newly decorated, but not adequate for a person with a fuller figure. Even me, being a uk size 14, struggled to get through the shower door!!! Had a problem with the room safe but the very helpful and very pleasant staff put it right almost immediately. Would stay there again as very good value for money. Location is superb for Gare de L'est and less than 10 minutes walk from the gare du nord - easily done even with large luggage. Beats paying the 10 euros taxi fare.

Reviews.Title: “The Price Is Right!”
Reviews.Author: P-Nutz
Reviews.Content: The Villa Saint Martin might not be the most luxurious hotel in the world, but it's hard to beat their rates! My room cost under $150 and I was pleased with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up to the Villa St. Matin”
Reviews.Author: cindy050
Reviews.Content: We loved the Villa St. Martin during our recent stay in Paris. Our 30 minute walk to the Ile de la Cite each morning was wonderful and full of interesting sights. The front desk was always pleasant and very helpful. The breakfast was a nice selection of bread, cheese, fruit salad and more. In the evening this room was a nice spot for a beer or wine or just to sit and chat and plan for the next day. Our room was somewhat small but it had everything we needed and the bathroom had recently been updated and was quite nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: actief
Reviews.Content: After a thorough search we booked this hotel, based mainly upon other travellers reviews. And I must say, it really is a very good deal in Paris. It's very clean, comfortable and quiet(!). Breakfast is good and the staff was very friendly and helpfull. The Hotel is also located very well. Arriving at gare du Nord you are at the Hotel within 10 minutes walking (2 minutes from gare de l'Est). From these Gare's you can reach any point in Paris within 5-10 minutes using the (excellent) Metro. At the Hotel itself and through their official website http://www.villastmartin.com the rates are a bit high. But through their alternative site http://paris-hotel-villa.com you can book at reduced and very reasonable prices. You can also use this site to check current public or reduced rates and call the Hotel to book directly referering to these prices. At those prices we can absolutely recommend this Hotel. When we return to Paris we'll return to Villa Saint Martin.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for.”
Reviews.Author: tfeb
Reviews.Content: I'll try and be brief and honest as possible. Ok Gare d'lest has two different entry points plus 4 subway entrances. So we spent the first 30 mins walking around the immediate area looking for the dam thing. There is no tourist info point in Gare'dlest and the security guard tried pointing us in completely the wrong direction. Obviously no fault of the hotels though and once we were there we wondered how we go it wrong! Front of house: Once of the best things about this hotel are the front of desk staff. All of them were really friendly, spoke good English and always wanted to help The Rooms: I have stayed in alot of hotels in my time and this was defiantly the smallest. All very nice and clean but yes small. Unfortunately there was no English speaking tv which while not a problem it would have been great to have one channel to watch in the morning such as cnn. But hey you get what you pay for. We paid £60 per night for 3 nights. Someone did mention this in another review and that is the walls are thin. I don't think the French bloke in the next room was happy that we and my g/f had booked a romantic weekend away......we had fun anyway! Location: When you leave the hotel you can turn left (towards Gar d'lest or right). perfect to get to the station. But if you are looking for a restaurant or a nice walk go right. Me and my g/f were amazed it was like two totally different parts of the city despite only being one street away. When you turn right at the end of the road there is a restaurant and a cafe opposite each other. Apologies but i can't remember the name of either. However the cafe served us an excellent lunch and the atmosphere in there was excellent. Across from here is a restaurant where we went on our final night. I searched for hours on the internet to find the perfect place in Paris to go on our last night and it was at the end of the road. The food was excellent and we had a few drinks. also. Price wise it probably costs just as much as any decent restaurant in Paris. We took 500 euros with us for the weekend. When it was gone it was gone. We travelled around on the tube which is very efficient and cheap. Get a carnet! - Basically this gives you ten tickets which we found was just enough for the weekend. Don’t eat and drink near the tourist attractions they just overcharge you. Find places to eat and drink even a 5/10 min walk away and you find the prices fall. By doing the above it meant we were able to see all that we wanted and then treat ourselves to a nice meal on the final night. Overall we had a great weekend and i wouldn't rule out a return to Paris. Would I stay at this hotel again? Well if i had the same budget constraints yes but hopefully in a few years time ill be able to afford something bigger and nicer. But i would definatly recommend to a friend and have no hesitation in saying its a perfect base if you wish to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and comfortable - what more do you want!?”
Reviews.Author: PinkL0u
Reviews.Content: We booked the Villa St. Martin after reading a number of favourable reviews on TripAdvisor and I'm pleased to say that we weren't disappointed. The hotel is very well situated within minutes walk of the Gare de L'Est which is quite a large station. From there, you are only a few minutes from most of the city's sights, via the Metro. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable and quiet at night. The room we has was small but I gather small rooms are the norm for the majority of Paris hotels. The bathroom was clean and there was plenty of warm water and clean towels. Breakfast was also pretty good, breads and cheeses, croissants and pain au chocolat, and coffee, tea and juice. The staff at the front desk were also helpful and could speak good english. The only criticisms i would make are that we had trouble finding nice places to eat at night in the immediate vicinity of the hotel - you really would need to get the metro into a livlier area of the city. All in all a very pleasant stay - not the height of luxury but all you really need for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “It's true what they say...all of it”
Reviews.Author: FrancoisP
Reviews.Content: When I researched the hotel I, too, was skeptical, but all the good things are true...and so is the one bad thing, but the bad thing isn't so bad. Very pretty hotel. All the amenities, although our friends' phone didn't work. We recommend Room 165. More remote. Overlooks the back yard. Room is Paris-type small, but redecorated recently and quite pleasant. Great bathroom; best shower ever: a $10,000, 8-head, does-everything toy. Great access to the city via the #4 Métro line and almost next to Gares de l'Est and du Nord. Situated near the prettiest bends of the Canal St. Martin. Incredibly outgoing desk staff. Great breakfast with buns, breads, cheeses, meats, cereals, drinks. The negative? Walls are thin, very thin, but then, if you're well behaved, maybe the others will be, too. We had no problems. #165 only has one room next door and one above. But you have to walk up a half-flight of stairs. We'd stay there again, and we go to Paris every year!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelmore20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 night in late February. It is a very good loaction, being across the street to one of the city's major Metro stations (Gare de L'Est). Several metro lines run through this stop, which make is very easy to get around without much switching of the trains. Definitely get a "carnet" (10 metro tickets package which reduces the price per ticket since you ar buying 10 at a time) when you first arrive in Paris if you are staying in this hotel, since you will be going to see all the sights via metro. So, great loaction. The bad? here it is: DO NOT LET THEM GIVE YOU ROOM 118!!!! The room is the size of my closet back in the states. At first I thought that all the rooms are like that and was OK with it, but then in the morning while the rooms were being cleaned and the doors were open I saw that all the other rooms were way bigger than my room! So, if you get assigned room 118 - request a reassignment to ANY other room, trust me. We had no room to open our suitcases. Another thing: the front desk staff tells you upon check in that every time you leave the hotel you should drop off your room key with them - kinda sketchy, but there is a safe in the room, so you can lock up whatever you think is of value. The breakfast is very good, great selection, good breads. The fron desk staff spoke English which made it very convenient. So over all, great location, many places to eat around the hotel, nice staff, but do not settle for room 118!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: SKDLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February. This is a good hotel for those who prefer to see Paris rather than a hotel room. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel (though Rue de Recollets at the front isn't very busy) on the 2nd floor. The room and bathroom were definitely compact but the furniture appeared to be fairly new as was the bathroom. Everything worked and you could open all the doors. The stairs are fairly narrow and steep and I didn't see the lift so perhaps not the best place to stay if you aren't fairly mobile. Breakfast was fine - fruit juice, fruit salad, bread, cold meats, cheese, bread, croissants and pastries plus coffee or tea. The breakfast room did get busy and we had to wait a few minutes for a table on the Saturday morning. The staff were helpful - they have a lap top you can borrow for internet access and there was a luggage room where you can leave bags after you checked out. The hotel is a little out of the centre but very close to Metro Gare de l'Est from with good access into the centre. In the other direction the Canal St Martin makes a pleasant stroll and has several cafes and bars - it must be pretty lively in the summer. We had a drink at L'Atmosphere on Rue des Recollects which was pleasant (and the food served on other tables looked good). We ate at Le Marin facing onto the canal - decent cafe/bar food with plenty of locals out for Friday night. Villa St Martin isn't luxurious but it is a quiet and comfortable base if you want to spend most of your time exploring Paris. It also appears to offer some very good deals on some websites making it very affordable for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cusip
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Gate 1 Travel and was very pleased with the location and amenities of this hotel. Very pleasant staff and close to the station which makes it easy to get around. The room is quite spacious considering our expectations is lower in the European hotels. Would recommend this hotel to our friends and if we ever come back we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, In Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoExpat
Reviews.Content: FIRST Off, This Place Was Rated In Top 5% Of Paris Hotels On HERE... So I Booked It! NOT Central, but 75 m from Gare d Este Metro/Train station, so convenient. Good access to public transportation, and 2? stops from Sacre Cour, to the North. 3-Star Hotel with 4-Star service! ALL the employees spoke perfect English, and balked at nothing! Lobby & breakfast room were very pleasant/modern! Breakfast buffet/daily got me through my HECTIC day, just fine! MODERN chrome/LED lift! The room was quite nice, with storage space for hanging clothes & drawers, built-in. NICE LCD TV, with cable channels. There was a sufficient desk area with room to write post-cards, and a safe (in wardrobe). The bathroom was MODERN with hair-dryer, makeup mirror, and LARGE tub/shower. Would DEFINITELY stay there, again... only about 3 km from City Center. GREAT Value, and quaint yet modern!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel great spot”
Reviews.Author: TripnAuckland
Reviews.Content: This was a great location 2 minutes walk from Gard de L'est, and the Metro, but tucked away from the noise. It was only 5 minutes on the Metro to Les Halles Shopping district, Galleria Lafaette and Au Pretimps. While the rooms were on the small side, we were there to sight see and shop, so it wasn't that much of an issue. The staff were excellent, they were very helpful and extremely friendly, and great with their english. Our 4 night Package included breakfast, which was a great way to start the day, while not a hot breakfast, there was plenty of everything else. It had a small life which while not uncommon in Europe, made it a little harder for getting up and down, at peak times like breakfast, but still a great stay. Paul from Auckland New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a very convenient area”
Reviews.Author: tottav
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the hotel and found it to be a great hotel for the price and we would definately stay there again. The location is excellent being across the street from the Gare d'est train station and Metro stop. Travelling out of Paris on the train and within the city on the Metro was extremely simple because of it. The rooms were clean, the breakfast was good. The only thing I would suggest is that the hotel get more english speaking stations/movies available on the Tv programming. The staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Greg_Annie
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located 1 city block from Gare de l'Est (for Metro lines everywhere in Paris, and indirect transit to/from CDG airport), it is nevertheless still offset on side street, away from nighttime noise. Wonderful front desk & breakfast room staff, all are enthusiastic and friendly, willing and able to speak french/english as you please. Can't say enough about their desire to oblige and make our 5 day visit in Paris perfect. Although the room was small, it was well-equipped, modern in its appointments, very well-designed, and spotless. Very nice breakfast buffet, with far more choices than in many US breakfast-included hotels. Our stay in Paris (for our 26th anniversary) was made very special largely due to the exceptionally caring staff, convenient location, and nicely-appointed accommodations at the VSM hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will definately return”
Reviews.Author: Carizma
Reviews.Content: We chose Villa Saint Martin for its location, very close to the metro and bus. The great staff was a bonus! I have never stayed in a hotel with such accommodating and friendly people. We speak very little french so it was nice to find that they spoke english. We will book a better room next time (we had a twin room). But our stay was great. The hotel is very clean, the view was nice from the 3 windows, and we even had a big flat screen TV. Breakfast was great to start the day, although we did have to wait awhile for a table one morning. The location was better than expected. Not only were we close to the metro (the week pass is easiest and cheapest) but there were plenty of restaraunts, bakeries and shops nearby. This hotel is a super value and I highly recommend it to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “It's defintiely good”
Reviews.Author: nickpb
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel given that it is often available at deeply discounted prices through various booking sites. Staff are friendly, rooms are well kept and nicely appointed, and importantly, reliable wireless internet is provided (why do so many places either not have it or grossly overcharge?). Although rated a 3 star, I have certainly stayed in worse 4 stars than this one. Probably worth considering even at standard price, but a rare find if you can obtain it discounted...

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Villa Saint Martin”
Reviews.Author: lisalisaingrid
Reviews.Content: After looking at reviews on this website we chose Villa Saint Martin for our 3 day stay in Paris. We weren't disappointed either - the rooms were clean, the breakfast was simple but good. We wound up getting a larger than average room and felt we had ample space. The bathroom was modern and very nice. The staff was especially helpful and friendly. We also liked the location - which was important as we got there the first day of the transportation worker strike and the trains weren't running. We found it easy to walk to most sites without much difficulty. (we never made it to the Eiffel Tower though). It would have been an even better site if the trains were running as there are stops very close by. There is a bike rental site right outside the hotel - although it seemed to fill up, so if you plan to bike home be sure to know where the next closest rental site is. Wi-fi is available in the dining room - you can get a lap top from the front desk if you like. A great place to stay if you are coming in via Eurostar. Overall, a great value. Thanks Villa Saint Martin!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirkou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at the Hotel St Martin during our honeymoon. We had a very nice stay. The room was clean and cosy although was extremely small. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good enough to start your day although the breakfast room is quite small - but stylish - and is possible not to find free table right away. Generally it is a very nice, clean hotel. But it is also very small. Small rooms, corridors and elevator. This was not a problem for us but if you need something big and luxury you should find something else and of course pay much more. We also recommended it because it is in a very good location, just 2 minutes walk from the train-metro station, from where you can go anywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nymsel
Reviews.Content: A Pefect Paris Hotel - Great Value, friendly staff and well located The rooms are indeed smaller then you would expect, but for 2 of us it was just fine; you are meant to go to Paris to go out all day, the room is only for sleeping - if you are very fat (or American) then do not stay here it will be too small for you It is less then ten minute to walk to from Gare du Nord with a case on wheels, if you have just come off the Euro Star - 4 minutes from the hotel door and you are on the Metro at Gare du Est, which will take you any where in Paris... The staff are friendly and all speak perfectly good English - which is actually annoying when you are trying to practice your French as they pick up on the accent and reply to you in English - I tried, I really tried to keep the conversation going in French but they even know the London Slang!! Do your self a favour and for a great value short break in Paris stay at this hotel - Ps the breakfast is great too, with in 5 mins walk you have half a dozen good places to eat from the expensive but so so good Strasbourger to the better value Piano Bar,or Le Tramways de l'Est for a great set manu with oysters

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KLMboy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Paris in August and stayed at Ville St. Martin. We were very impressed the soon we entered the lobby. The staff was very friendly. Though we did not speak French very well they were pleased to attend us in English. The breakfast was modest but certainly good enough, especially those French croissants. The room felt a bit small, but who cares. There is more to see in Paris than your hotel room. The hotel was conveniently situated on walking distance of Gare de L'est (train station). There is a pretty good connection to down town with the tube (or Metro whatever you prefer). We could also use the internet free of charge to check in for our flight back home, and even print out our boarding pass. That's what I call great service. Next time we are in Paris, we defenitely will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks St. Martin”
Reviews.Author: eswens
Reviews.Content: Thru Gate One travel. Very friendly. Good breakfast. The St. Martin canal is very interesting. Boats and locks two blocks away. Loaned us 5 Euros when we arrived and supplied an electrical outlet adapter. Help with directions. No reluctance to speak to us very competently in English. Metro is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: chadblessing
Reviews.Content: We were only in Paris one night, so I do not have much to compare it to, but I was very pleased with our stay. We were traveling by train so it was conveniently located near two train stations. The staff was very helpful and the hotel was very well kept. We speak very little French, but the staff was able to communicate just fine in English and were very helpful and very kind. The rooms were nice. All in all, I have no complaints and was quite pleased with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket!”
Reviews.Author: London2Travellers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three days in Paris and it was lovely to be based in the Villa Saint Martin - so close to the Metro and with easy access to the sights. Staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfasts plentiful and enjoyable, the room basic but comfortable and very clean. Thanks to all the reception staff for a friendly, helpful and courteous welcome. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: juicebuster
Reviews.Content: Our stay coincided with the 2007 World Cup. So the Hotel was busy1 This small family run hotel is spotless. Our room and lounge of the hotel were tastefully decorated although the room was small. But aren't all Paris hotels! We stayed for 2 nights and felt the friendlyness of all the staff helped make our stay very comfortable. The reception is open 24hrs and they will even look after your luggage when you check out if you want to spend the rest of the day in Paris. Although the bar is not manned all the time the reception will arrange for any drinks you want. The 2 large flat screen TV's make good viewing should you want to wish to catch up up on some news.The breakfast was well presented. Cold meats, rolls, good coffee, cereal, juice, eggs and plenty of all made the experience most enjoyable. My first trip to Paris and should I return I would have no worries booking into this hotel. Overall I was very impressed with what I experienced. The staff were happy to help and guided me most successfully with my train ticket purchases,day trips out and resturants to eat. If you want a clean, small, excellent value for money hotel, close to the main stations then try out this hotel. You wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: EdwinQueensland
Reviews.Content: As first time travellers to Paris and only being able to speak english we though that we might have a few problems getting around. These problems were overcome to a large extent by the friendly and helpful hotel staff. There seemed to be no problem that they could not assist us with including organising trips, airport shuttles and recommending places to eat. Being close to Gare de l'est and Gare du nord was very good as we just walked from the Eurostar to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise, great hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: BFFTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel we left in London was old. What a pleasant surprise when we arrived at Villa Saint Martin, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean & decore cute. Loved the windows that opened up and the flower pots outside the windows. The three flights of stairs was a workout. The breakfast was great. We were late for breakfast the 1st morning and they were gracious to let us serve ourselves while they were shutting the buffet down. Hotel is very close to the train station, we didn't know that until the very last day!! Metro station was very close too. I would stay at the Villa Saint Martin again.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Saint Martin a thieves paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Shahze
Reviews.Content: Villa saint martin, St. Martin would turn in his grave if he comes to know that his name is associated with this hotel. This is typical example of a hotel which has all the amenities of a 3 star but it is infact a 1 star hotel. The rooms are no bigger than the bathrooms at my house. The breakfast is not so great and with just one person serving you can imagine what it is like. The location is in one of the bylanes near the Gard De Lést station. A rundown an impoverished neighbourhood the rooms are tiny and the walls seem to be made of thermocol so much that if the person in the next room farts you are sure to hear it. The corridors are so small that two ppl cannot walk side by side you have to go and come in a single file. The lift seems to be an afterthought. The new wing or the so called renovated wing is the one of the worst rooms i have ever seen. Once inside you feel you are in a Hell Hole. I stayed here for 4 nights and I know. Some how this hotel seems to be popular with the tourists and i just cannot fathom WHY?? They have nothing going for them Bad service, Tiny rooms, Smelly corridors, No Porterage, Breakfast which is so good you just want to run away from it. The only saving grace in this hotel is Andy the concierge who is always smiling and trying his level best to give his guests the best service that he can. A very helpful and genuine person. But beware thieves do lurk in the lobby of this hotel which i found out after losing my handbag and with Andy on a holiday the other staff was just not ready to accept that my bag was stolen from the lobby. When I asked for the address of the nearest police station to my surprise they replied they have never seen one. DO NOT STAY HERE. Gard de Lést and Gard du Nord areas are not for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: starkswetumpka
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I celebrated a special in Paris. We had the pleasure of staying at the Villa Saint Martin. We had a wonderful time. The rooms were quaint and clean; the food was appetizing. The ambiance was a blend of old world and modern Paris. The hotel was within walking distance to the Euro train station, taxis and the Metro. Restaurants and eateries were abound. The staff was so accommodating, attentive and most of all friendly. I experienced a crisis while abroad and they went above and beyond to assist me. I would like to acknowledge some of the staff; Mrs. Agnes, Mr. Jacopo and a special thanks to Mr. Adis. They and others made our stay most enjoyable. It is because of their graciousness and professionalism and the overall expericence, I am recommending this hotel to my daughter and her husband and several other friends who plan to visit Paris next year.

Reviews.Title: “Really confortable, friendly, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelNut
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for our first anniversary. Neither of us knew what to expect as we had heard bad things about the smaller Paris hotels. However, we were more than pleasantly surprised. My husband had asked them to have roses and champagne chilled and waiting in the room and they were more than ready to accommodate his request. It was there waiting when we arrived and was good value for money. The room is a modest but standard European room size. It was very very clean. No funny smells, no unpleasant stains and had air conditioning. We had three full French windows that opened completely and had a good view of the city. It looked onto a park across the street as well. The bathroom was clean, with nice toiletries and the toilet flushed well. House keeping came every morning without fail. The free breakfast buffet is fantastic! There are three choices of jams, three choices of cold meats, three choices of cheese, two types of juice, plenty of coffee, espresso etc. The freshest yummiest chocolate croissants and plain croissants and raisin brioche and hard boiled eggs as well as baguettes. There were also two choices of cereals and melon fruit every morning already cut into cubes as well as several flavours of yogurt and to finish off, many types of teas. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and speak English. The location is near many restaurants (The Little Regina is really nice) and cafes. One piece of advice for travelers is arrive at the various museums before 9am or you will end up waiting for hours in the hot sun. We only made that mistake once. Avoid ALL touristy restaurants if you want to eat good French food.

Reviews.Title: “Well-Worth-It Hotel :]”
Reviews.Author: Carlie--x
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really good. It has everything you need. Hairdryer, Big Samsung TV, Air-Con, Wardrobes, Full length Mirror, Walk in shower/Tub, Telephone,Toilitries [Shampoo && Soap] etc Staff there are very friendly and speak English and French. Breakfast is small but cosy and the food consists of; -Yoghurt, Fruit, Croissants, A selection of jam, Ham, Cheese, Haird boiled eggs, Many different types of bread. Drinks include; -Fresh Orange and tropical juice, Many different types of tea [Mint, Earl Grey, Jasmine, Rosemary etc] and a coffee machine that does hot chocolate, cappaciouno, coffee etc The breakfast room plays music and has two wide screen Samsung TV's where you can watch the daily news. There are 5 floors of the hotel and these can be accessed by stairs and a lift. The corridors are quite narrow but are manageable to walk through.
